Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game is a Living Card Game set in the world of Rokugan, the original setting for the Legend of the Five Rings collectible card game. To play a Living Card Game, players create individual decks of cards from a base game with a fixed set of cards; they can then add supplemental card packs to this game world, with each pack also having a fixed set of cards, in order to vary their game experience.

While the connection of Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game to Rokugan and the Colonies — as well as its pervasive themes of honor, nobility, magic, intrigue, duty, and warfare — should carry over from the original L5R CCG, Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game is not compatible with that original game and will feature significant changes in the game mechanisms.

184152.name: Ide4s
184152.description:
Write down a secret word to do with a specific topic and use your imagination. During the game you will have to carry out 5 different tests: coincide with your teammates, try not to repeat the same as them, avoid secret words, discover secret topics and be the one to find the most words, all at blistering page.

In this word game a card theme is shown and then a dice is rolled to indicate the rule players have to follow this turn. Then they have 30 seconds to write 4 words that accomplish the rule. They will score one point for each right word. At the end of the game the player with the most points is the winner.

184154.name: Mi Mic
184154.description:
You can mime as many words of "subject", "action" or "object" as you like. Your teammates must guess them and make with them all the craziest sentence possible. But beware, if you risk too much and the time runs out, you will lose everything.

Playing by teams in your turn you have to roll the dice and take as many cards as it showed. Then, turn down the sand clock and you have to mime all the cards. When your mates guess them, they have to construct a sentence with all of them to win the cards. If done, you can choose to roll the dice again and take new cards but if your time ends before they get the words and the sentence, you will lose the cards and some of yours yet won. At the end of the game, team with most cards is the winner.

184155.name: Fakes
184155.description:
Tell an anecdote about the chosen topic and listen to those of your opponents. A secret card wil let you know whether you should tell the truth or lie. You must make everyone believe you, and use your wits to discover which of your opponents is lying.

Each player receives secretly a card that indicates if he has to say the truth or lying. Then, a theme card is showed and every player explains a personal history on the theme lying or telling the truth depending on his card. When finising all players can make questions to the others to guess if they're lying or not. Before that, they count up to three and everybody points the person who he thinks is the liar.

You get points discovering the liar and when anybody thinks that are you and it's not. Five cards are played and then the player with most points wins.

184156.name: On the Top
184156.description:
On the Top is a game that will test what you know about your teammates and your reaction speed. First is assigned a "nickname" to each player. Then each turn is read a card with a condition like "he has the longest tongue", "he has more brothers", "more holes in the belt" ... and everyone will have to draw who believe that meets at the same time you say his nickname in the game.

First player to guess who meets better the condition will win the card. Game finishes when anybody wins 5 cards.

Do you really know your friends? And your partner?

184157.name: Fast Words
184157.description:
Fast Words is a very fast game to form words, where you have 8 letters and a theme, and have to decide a word that relates to the theme, using as many letters as possible and do it the first time.

A word about "something with a lot of hair" ... What you thought? Or another about something that "has holes."

A pile of theme cards is placed on the center of the table surrounded by 8 cards with one letter in each one. When showed the first theme card players have to find a word on the theme that have at least one of the showed letters. Who founds put his hand over the theme pile, say the word and takes all the letters contained in it. The rest of the players plays the same way until only one player has no said any word. Then, letters are replaced and a new theme is showed. Player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

184158.name: Badlands: A Wasteland Game
184158.description:
User summary:

Badlands is heavily influenced by the computer games Fallout (Interplay Entertainment) and X-COM (MicroProse), deriving its setting from Fallout and its mechanics from X-COM. The game is set in the post-apocalyptic USA along the California-Nevada border. Characters exist in a largely lawless frontier that is full of environmental hazards and nefarious actors.

Characters have five attributes (Strength, Intelligence, Dexterity, Agility, and Constitution), one class (Soldier, Survivalist, Medic, Rogue, Mechanic, or Scientist), and several skills. Characters gain experience and levels. Combat occurs in fairly traditional rounds, with initiative, armor class, and damage rolls. A streamlined combat round for "Cannon Fodder" is provided. Characters depend heavily on equipment and especially a wide variety of weapons.

The "Version 1.1" edition of the game varies from the "Version 1.0.1" edition in minor corrections, copy editing, and formatting. Some minor organizational changes were also made.

184159.name: Elefun & Friends Mouse Trap
184159.description:
A new and simplified version for the famous game Mouse Trap using the characters from Elefun & Friends.

The trap is built at the setup and, although different, has the same basic elements of the original.

You do not have to collect cheese anymore and the movement is determined by a spin wheel with three colors.

The board is smaller and composed by a path of colors where some of the spaces have also a boot indicating that the player may activate the trap and try do capture a mouse. The first player to capture a mouse wins the game.

184161.name: Descent into the Candy Crypts
184161.description:
From the introduction:

Descent into the Candy Crypts is a mini-module for Crimson Dragon Slayer, a science fiction and fantasy pa- per & pencil roleplaying game for the Old School Renaissance. It is meant to be compatible with nearly every RPG derived from the first of its kind. Descent into the Candy Crypts is a parody, joke, spoof, etc. This book does not own the rights to various intellectual properties mentioned or implied. The rights to reproduce this work are reserved for the copyright holder.

184162.name: Invizimals Desafío X-Tractor
184162.description:
Become a member of the Alliance of Hunters, travels the Invizmals world and capture the most powerful ones, train them and make them evolve to fight the X-Tractor commander ... but beware, the journey is full of dangers.

A game based on the Invizimal license from Sony where the players has to stop the invasion of their world capturing Invizimals and fighting with them again the X-Tractors using their power dice and cards. Combats can be made too using an specific App.

184165.name: Barbar Rollespillet
184165.description:
User summary:

Characters are, by definition, dirty, stupid, and obnoxious barbarians trying to get by in a civilized world. Characters distribute eleven points among six attributes (Scout, Move, Keep, Special X, Special Y, and Talk), with each score ranging from one to three. Perhaps the most significant attribute is Talk, giving characters five vocabulary words per point (e.g., five to fifteen words). The Talk score also determines how many words can be strung together in a sentence or understood when listening (e.g., one to three).

In play, characters are able to do only those things the player can express using the characters' limited vocabulary. Each character does get some "free" vocabulary words, however: their name, "Ugh!", "Eh?", and "Uhm...", and "Yaaaa!". Sign language (mimicry, gestures, body language) may also be used when words fail.

All characters elect the Barbarguden, or leader. The Barbarguden takes the role of Game Master, making all decisions that need to be made. Barbarians come from the land of Hau and adventure into the land of Bort (the rest of the world).

The core mechanic for all opposed or non-trivial actions is a die roll. Characters attempt to roll d6 under the appropriate attribute. The Barbarguden can determine (generally, before rolling--but after rolling if sufficiently bribed) whether the dice result should be modified.

Characters do not advance during play, but there are four goals shared by all barbarians:
1- Make friends with some other barbarians,
2- Become King of the Hauenstein (King of Hau)
3- Go somewhere else
4- Other stuff

184166.name: El Juego del Real Madrid
184166.description:
A Trivial-like game with 2.600 questions about all facts and history about the soccer team Real Madrid. Players advance along the board tracks by correctly answering questions to complete his collection of trophies.
Depending on the squares where his pawns land they have to answer questions about specifics themes like players, history or prizes. But they can also stole trophies to the other players quicking penalties or dueling with questions with them.

184167.name: Schinderhannes: Schwarzer Peter
184167.description: Schinderhannes: Schwarzer Peter, an expansion for Schinderhannes, consists of eight "not true" cards. During the game, you can play one of these cards with an information card to reverse the information provided by that card. If, for example, a player plays the card "Schinderhannes commits a crime in the east" and the "Schwarzer Peter" card, then the information becomes "Schinderhannes commits a crime not in the east" (i.e., he commits a crime in the west).

184168.name: Rangers Upon the Wild
184168.description:
User Summary

A Twine-based text adventure/role-playing game submitted for the Game Chef 2014 competition. It is intended to be played by several people simultaneously.

184169.name: Hoppla Dreizehn: Das neue Würfelroulett
184169.description: The players move their meeples on the yellow spaces from "Anfang" to "Ende" around the game board. Movement is determined by the black die. The only function of the three red dies is to roll a 13, wich grants the players some benefits. The red, green or black spaces above the yellow spaces, in combination with the result of the red dies, determine if the player loses or wins money.

184170.description: Light of Dragons is a tactical dice and positioning game in which players battle in the role of ancient peoples who are trying to become ruler over warring lands.
184170.name: Light of Dragons

184171.name: Dead Reign Sourcebook 5: Graveyard Earth
184171.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expand the Zombie Apocalypse around the world. Learn what’s happening in other countries worldwide, and see what threats might be coming from neighboring lands. What’s happening in other places? Has any government survived? Was any country left unscathed? Find the answers in this world-spanning sourcebook.

Also read about the best locations for establishing Safe Haven communities, and what regions and countries have the best odds for long-term survival. Plus survival tips and many random generation tables for travel and survival around the world. If you were a tourist or military personnel overseas, how would you survive in a foreign land, let alone get back home?

The state of the world. Adventure ideas galore.
The Zombie World Tour presents how the Wave and the Zombie Apocalypse have played out across the globe. Every country in the world has been touched and changed by the rise of the dead.
Random Safe Havens by region.
Many Random Tables for Settings, Locations, Safe Havens and more.
Generate Random Survivor Leaders.
Zombie Threat Level Table and encounters on the road.
Trapped abroad? How do you get home in a world of zombies? *Data and tables for aircraft landing conditions and travel by road and by sea.
A must-have book for players and Game Masters alike.

184172.description:
Vengeance and Devotion! Inquisitors root out enemies of their faith by any means necessary. The Inquisitor Class Deck accessory for the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game allows players to bring these determined zealots to any Base Set, including the demon-infested Wrath of the Righteous campaign!

The 109-card Inquisitor Class Deck contains three new characters—including a new version of the iconic inquisitor Imrijka—and both new and familiar weapons, spells, items, and other boons that will serve your inquisitor through an entire Adventure Path. This deck can also be used in the wildly popular Pathfinder Society Adventure Card Guild organized play campaign.
184172.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Class Deck – Inquisitor
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

184173.name: Heavenly Host
184173.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the Greatest Good!

Mythic Monsters: Heavenly Host brings you a dozen and one celestial servants that bring down their beatific best from the realms empyreal and eternal, bringing justice like a flaming sword and righteousness like a mighty flowing river. These champions of all that is good and pure are a match and more for all the legions of the nether reaches of the planes, smiting demons, daemons, devils, and all their ilk with alacrity and elan, or living among mortals as watchful wardens ever ready to spring to the aid of the innocent. From CR 3 to 28, you'll find agathions and angels that wander the material world granting succor and companionship like the cassisian angel and the silvanshee and vulpinal agathions. You'll find celestial sentinels that guard the natural world and those that dwell therein like the avoral and cetaceal and the monadic and movanic devas, and wise counselors who look deeply into the hearts of mortals to lead them towards greater wisdom themselves, like the astral deva and the draconal, or bringing messages directly from the powers of good, like the planetars. Finally, you have the crusading swords of judgment, who destroy the wicked wherever they are found, like the proud leonals and the mighty solars. As if a dozen existing monsters were not enough, the rhampholeal agathion are clever spies for the followers of the light, infiltrating and uncovering corrupt cabals and bringing them down from within. For mortals wishing to follow the path of purity, we also introduce a system of sacred feats, which a hero cannot simply gain but must be earned by dedication and devotion to holy vows in service of the better angels of her nature.

184174.description:
Contains 3 Bone Devils minatures and hero cards to expand Rum & Bones.

Included heroes: Captain Dracula, Renfield the Bloodcrazed (Swashbuckler), and Deadalus the Soul Herald (Quartermaster).
184174.name: Rum & Bones: Bone Devils Heroes Set #1

184175.name: Infinite Gear 2
184175.description:
From publisher blurb:

What Sci-Fi is complete without some cool gear to play with. Well Avalon is here with a whole new series of gear books for IF 2.0 Inside you will find all minds of cool things to use in your game, so strap on your new toys and conjure the universe.

184176.name: Beachside Fun
184176.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born with an affinity for the sea, but does their past hold mysteries for all of ponykind? Considered least of the tribes by some, is this perhaps the greatest falling known to the ponies?

New feats, spells, a new racial type, and lore all designed for sea ponies!

184177.name: Gray Nebula: Crewmen, Con-Men, and Lawmen
184177.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gray Nebula: Crewmen, Con-Men, and Lawmen is a class sourcebook designed for compatibility with White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying. It contains three (3) new classes that are fully compatible with the four Standard Classes found in the White Star core rulebook. Gray Nebula also introduces the concept of Roles which further breaks down each class into areas of expertise.

These new classes can be used to "fill in the gaps" for players who have no wish to be Aristocrats, Pilots, Mercenaries, or Star Knights. Or, they can be used strictly as NPCs, at the Referee's discretion.

NEW CLASSES

CREWMAN: Not everyone gets to be the dashing Pilot! Crewmen are mechanics, gunners, security officers, navigators, and any other type of support personnel that serve aboard a starship. On large vessels, with hundreds of workers, they sometimes get lost in the shuffle, but on smaller starships they can become essential and valued members of the crew.
CRIMINAL: Criminals prey upon the weak and unsuspecting. They take what they want and do as they please. Criminals can be common street thugs, gang members, con-men, thieves, robbers, murderers, slavers, or even worse. A rare few criminals skirt the line between good and evil; an even rarer few actually commit crimes for the benefit of others.
LAWMAN: Lawmen are tasked with enforcing laws and customs. They can be local constables, criminal investigators, interdiction agents, planetary marshals, or any other type of law enforcement officer. Some former Lawmen become bounty hunters, private investigators, corporate security officers, or personal bodyguards. A rare few turn their backs on the law entirely and become criminals of the worst sort. The latter tend to be hated by other Lawmen who use all available means to bring them to justice.




MAJOR NPCS
Gray Nebula also includes nine (9) fully statted NPCs (three for each new class). These NPCs come complete with backgrounds and adventure seeds that are designed to be dropped into any White Star campaign.

184178.name: Mercenary Companies
184178.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conflict has been a feature of Shaintar for as long as anyone can remember. Kingdoms have waged war with the forces of flame and darkness, and when there's a lull then inevitably one nation starts a war with another.

Where there's war, there will be mercenaries. In Shaintar the most storied mercenary companies are famous across the realm, their names linked to countless battles. The Shadow Falcons, the Riders of the Light, the Warmakers and many more.
In this book we outline the main mercenary companies, their command structure, their individual styles of combat, and where you're most likely to find them being active. We even offer a few edges... perhaps one of your Shaintar heroes has spent some time among the mercenaries and learned a thing or two.

Black Lantern Reports are short books giving an overview of an organization or group with great influence on heroes' lives. Rather than being packed with many new rules, they are designed to add flavor to your games, to act as a launch pad from which to create interesting encounters and side-plots to your own epic campaign.

184179.description:
Contains 9 Kraken Tentacle miniatures and 1 Sea Dragon miniature. These miniatures replace two tokens from the game. They do not change game play.

They come packaged separately (with their own product number) and while they were part of the Kickstarter bonus stuff, they were also available for purchase separately.
184179.name: Rum & Bones: Sea Creatures Pack

184180.description:
Contains 3 Wellsport Brotherhood minatures and hero cards to expand Rum & Bones.

Included heroes: Captain Anne Bonny, Grace O'Malley (Gunner), and Theo, the Terror of Nova (Quartermaster).
184180.name: Rum & Bones: Wellsport Brotherhood Heroes Set #1

184181.name: Suzerain  (Pathfinder)
184181.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your gaming group just became a pantheon in the making!

This new edition of Suzerain gives you the tools to play a Demigod in an infinite multiverse of parallel realms! Don't get too cocky though, it also includes threats worthy of a demigod!

Suzerain takes characters from one world to another or even to another time. History and fantasy, past present and future - they are all your playground now.

Inside these covers you'll find:

All the background you'll need to run games set in any time, and any place.
48 new Pulse feats, allowing you to tap into the life energy of the multiverse! .
Telesmae - bonded, semi-intelligent items that grow with your character!
Your Pocket Realm! An extradimensional hideaway that grows as your heroes grow in power!
Flexing a Nexus - use your godlike powers to warp the nature of reality itself!
30 mini-scenarios including a campaign outline spanning the main eras of a character's development from Neophyte to Demigod!




Where most campaigns and adventure paths finish, Suzerain is just getting started. With Suzerain a starting character can expect to become true hero of the multiverse, meet the gods themselves, and become a Demigod!

To gain the full use of this product you will need copies of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rules and The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Player’s Guide. Let your imagination run wild!

184182.description:
Contains 3 Mazu's Dreadful Curse minatures and hero cards to expand Rum & Bones.

Included heroes: Captain Shu Ming, Ai Fei (Brute), and Lien Hua (Swashbucker).
184182.name: Rum & Bones: Mazu's Dreadful Curse Heroes Set #1

184183.description:
Contains 3 La Brise Sanguine minatures and hero cards to expand Rum & Bones.

Included heroes: Captain Francois l'Olonnias, Mademoiselle Defarge (Quartermaster), and Vivienne, the Sea Fox (Swashbuckler).
184183.name: Rum & Bones: La Brise Sanguine Heroes Set #1

184184.description:
Contains 3 Mercenary minatures and hero cards to expand Rum & Bones.

Included heroes: Captain Sarah Kale, Sinbad (Swashbucker), and Sir Alexander (Quartermaster).
184184.name: Rum & Bones: Mercenaries Heroes Set #1

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
184185.name: Relentlessly Gay
184185.description:
From publisher blurb:

NINJAS AND INVENTORS AND RAINBOW DRAGONS... OH MY!

The Mustache, the most evil of evil masterminds, decides the Gay Agenda isn't advancing fast enough. To find someone worthy of assisting him, he plucks gay men and women out of time and space and forces them to do battle in his secret arena. But will good triumph over evil and turn his schemes back on him?

Years in the making, Relentlessly Gay collects more than 20 pre-generated characters and dozens of traits and battle maneuvers not found in the core rules into a single book, as well as throwing in a few new tidbits. You'll find almost every single gay character that has appeared previously in a ROLF! battle scenario (from the villianous to the virtuous), as well as the never-before-seen Rainbow Dragon.

Relentlessly Gay also includes feats and talent trees for those who might want to make specifically gay characters in games that use pretty much any d20 System variant you can think of. Some of the feats have previously appeared in Feats of an Adult Nature or Devils in Petticoats, but the talent trees are new to this release.

184186.description:
Those that built this temple made sure that nobody would come and disturb their precious treasure. You’d best know some of its secrets before setting foot inside or each step could be your last.

This expansion contains 96 additional cards that will greaten the size of the Continent and offer you a new curse to unravel!
184186.name: The 7th Continent: The Forbidden Sanctuary

184187.description:
Exclusive set of Mercenary heroes for Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Contains 5 minatures & hero cards.

Included heroes: Captain Cherry Cutlass, First Mate Drissele (Quartermaster), Kusia the Assassin (Swashbucker), Rex "Baldy" Maraud (Gunner), and Rolf "Shorty" Copperhead (Brute).
184187.name: Rum & Bones: Skullkickers

184188.name: Ancient World: Bestiarum Vocabulum (Savage Worlds)
184188.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bestiarum Vocabulum presents a collection of dark fantasy bestiary for Ancient World and is usable with any dark fantasy setting.

Bestiarum Vocabulum includes:

57 unique creatures.
Over 75 adversary stat blocks.
Fully illustrated entries.
Full description and physiology of each creature.
Plagued and Diseased versions of many creatures.
... and more!

184189.description:
Exclusive set of Mercenary heroes for Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Contains 5 minatures & hero cards.

Included heroes: Captain Hannah Horn, Marie Sue (Quartermaster), Killer Kaya (Gunner), Penny Broke (Swashbuckler), and Hilda, the Valkyrie (Brute).
184189.name: Rum & Bones: Luck Goddesses

184190.name: Crazy Therapy!!
184190.description:
Crazy Therapy!! is a competitive card game in which two teams exchange in turns the roles of "patients" and "therapists".

Each team draws a card of the deck (48 cards total), which represents a "pathology" (a pattern behavior they have to perform in their "patients" turn)
There´s plenty of funny pathology types, like identity disorders where you have to "be" another specific player, behavior disorders, TICs, and much more madness!!

In the "therapist" turn, you have to ask the patients with questions whose answer should be YES or NO. When all the therapists have asked a question, they can try to make a diagnosis in the end of the turn in an attempt to win. There´s also two special clues in each card: "lamp" and "dartboard". The therapists can request the "lamp" clue at the beginning of their turn, but this has a penalty: they lose the entire turn and they are forced from this moment to reveal their own "dartboard" clue if they fail a diagnosis.

There´s also a special event called "Therapy" when a patient shouts "THERAPY!! and all the patients should switch seats randomly between themselves (note that lots of pathologies take into account some sort of "possitioning" pattern, so i.e.: if you have to act and answer like the person at your right, this changes your answers after a Therapy! because there´s another person at your right!), this event can happens when:

-The patient don´t know the answer of a question.
-The pathology says to do it or when it´s impossible to follow it´s indications.
-A patient fails to following the pattern or indication of the pathology (in which case, if you detect a teammate patient "fails", you should shout Therapy!!)

The goal is to discover the opponents pathology (the "pattern") before they discovers yours!

A fast and funny game that can join in the same table every profile of board game player!!
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Crazy Therapy!! es un juego de cartas competitivo en el que dos equipos intercambian los roles de "pacientes" y "terapeutas".

Cada equipo roba una carta del mazo (hay 48 en total), que representa una "patología" (un patrón de comportamiento que tendrán que interpretar en su turno como "pacientes")
Hay muchos tipos de patologías divertidas, como trastornos de identidad donde tendréis que "suplantar" a otro jugador específico, trastornos de comportamiento, tics, ¡¡y muchas mas demencias!!

En el turno de "terapeutas", tendréis que preguntar a los pacientes con preguntas cuya respuesta deba ser SI o NO. Cuando todos los terapeutas han preguntado, pueden intentar hacer un diagnóstico al final del turno para intentar ganar. Hay también dos pistas especiales en cada carta: "bombilla" y "diana". Los terapeutas pueden solicitar la pista "bombilla" al inicio de su turno, pero esto tiene un precio: perderán automáticamente el turno y además, a partir de ese momento estarán obligados a revelar su propia pista "diana" al equipo rival si fallan un diagnóstico.

Hay también un caso especial llamado "Terapia" donde un paciente grita ¡¡TERAPIA!! y todos los pacientes deben intercambiarse aleatoriamente los asientos entre ellos mismos (ten en cuenta que muchas patologías juegan con algún factor de posicionamiento en su patrón, así que por ejemplo: si tienes que actuar y responder como la persona de tu derecha, ¡esto cambia tus respuestas tras una Terapia! ya que ahora habrá otra persona a tu derecha!), este evento ocurre cuando:

-El paciente desconoce la respuesta a una pregunta.
-Lo indica la patología o es imposible cumplir su directriz.
-El paciente falla al interpretar el patrón o la indicación de la patología (en cuyo caso, si detectas un compañero paciente "fallar" deberás gritar ¡Terapia!

¡El objetivo del juego es descifrar la patología rival (el patrón/funcionamiento) antes de que ellos descubran la vuestra!

¡¡Un juego rápido y divertido que unirá en la misma mesa a todos los perfiles de jugadores de mesa!!

184191.name: The Ten Foot Pole (Issue 01 - Aug 2015)
184191.description:
From the publisher's description:

In this inaugural issue we learn about two conjoined shops - The Molted Branch and the strange little store called Potives & Scriptorium. Depending upon which store you enter, you may find an excellent alchemical mixture to help your explorer, or they could very well end up IN the mixture!

184192.name: The Ten Foot Pole (Issue 02 -  Sep 2015)
184192.description:
From the publisher's description:

In this issue we delve into the bowls of a university basement lab to discover a cult practicing the dark arts!

184194.name: Everyman Unchained: Unchained Cunning
184194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Assassinate your enemies, spy on friend and foe alike, or sneak a bit of poison into an unsuspecting person's meal with Everyman Unchained: Unchained Cunning by Everyman Gaming, LLC. Designed for players looking to further unchain their skillful assassins and rakish rogues, Everyman Unchained: Unchained Cunning continues Everyman Gaming, LLC's best-selling line of class and option updates for use with Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Pathfinder Unchained.

Everyman Unchained: Unchained Cunning includes:

The Unchained Ninja, an update to the ninja alternate class that helps to bring this stealthy warrior more in-line with the revised rogue class.
All-new rogue talents, ninja tricks, investigator talents, and slayer talents for use with Pathfinder Unchained, as well as an in-depth guide on how to update rogue talents that existed before Pathfinder Unchained to the revised rogue class.
New archetypes for rogue and ninja characters.




And much more!

184195.description:
Exclusive set of Mercenary Tide Cards for Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Contains 30 cards.

This special Tide Deck is only available to a crew composed entirely of Mercenaries. It allows you to use them as their own faction, however they'll need to "borrow" some resources from another faction, such as ship(s), Deployment Point tokens and Objective Tiles.
184195.name: Rum & Bones: Mercenary Tide Deck

184196.description: A set of 50 coins in either plastic or metal, to replace the cardboard tokens included in Rum & Bones.
184196.name: Rum & Bones: Coin Pack

bgaccessoryversion: La Brise Sanguine / Blue Bone Dice
Mazu's Dreadfull Curse / Yellow Bone Dice
184197.description:
A set of 6 custom plastic dice to replace the dice included in Rum & Bones.

The dice come in faction-specific colors (teal, purple, yellow, blue, light blue, dark yellow, grey, green) and black.
184197.name: Rum & Bones: Custom Dice

184198.name: Herbs of the Desert
184198.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Oasis of Magic!

Do you wish that alchemy in your game had a little more “oomph?” Have you ever been disappointed that no matter what it is that you’re trying to craft, all it takes is gold, time, and a skill check, with no concern as to what ingredients you’re using or how they’re prepared? Have you ever GM’d for a player who always seemed to want to wander off into the woods (or the merchant district) in search of rare and exotic reagents and compounds for his next magical experiment, and struggled to come up with an exciting and suitably fantastic material for him to find?

Then this is the book for you. Successor to the critically-acclaimed A Necromancer’s Grimoire: The Secret of Herbs and A Necromancer’s Grimoire: Herbs of the Jungle, A Necromancer's Grimoire: Herbs of the Desert continues its predecessors' unique approach to the sorts of low-cost special substances that can be created with the Craft (alchemy) skill. Presented herein are ten new desert-themed herbs with very special properties, as well as everything you need to know about how to use them in your game.

Take for example the clinging fire plant. A parasitic herb, clinging fire is a bright red mass of needle-like webbing that grows beneath the skin of plants and animals, and is one of the few herbs that may wind up harvesting you, instead! Those brave enough to gather a few doses might use them to make a clinging fire bomb, a nasty splash weapon that exposes those it hits to the herb's spores, possibly infecting them with the parasite. Alternatively, it can be used to make the sickness siphon, an auto-immune booster that helps the body fight off diseases and infections using the dead clinging fire pathogen as a decoy.

Or perhaps you prefer the walking cactus, a monstrous plant that lives up to its name, and is the only herb that can truly fight back. These creatures may be monsters (with full stat-blocks for standard, giant, and deadly walking cactuses), but they're also herbs, and harvesting doses from slain walking cactuses can grant the ability to craft potent thorn armor, which damages those who attack you, cactus drool, a nasty acidic substance, or reinvigoration serum, a powerful curative, all of which are more effective the larger the walking cactus that they were harvested from.

Other highlights include berries that can render you invisible for a short time, poisons that are resistant to magical healing, numerous different perfumes, all of which enhance one's interpersonal skills in subtly different ways, and a very potent elixir that offers a permanent one-time increase to the imbiber's caster level.

By themselves, each herb can be specially prepared into a handful of different special substances called preparations with a successful check, and further information outlines additional compounds and poisons that can be created by mixing two of these herbs together, for a total of over 70 new special substances and poisons.

Also included are guidelines for foraging and preparing these herbs, as well as optional rules for cultivating herbs deliberately and identifying the properties of unknown herbs, and many of the herbs in this book have special properties even without any special preparation. Whether you want to make the best alchemist (or witch, or hedgewizard, or even druid or ranger) ever, and display your superior knowledge of special plants, or just want to make sure that your players never look at a flower stand the same way ever again, don’t pass this book up.

184199.description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to explore and mess up the objects given to you at the beginning of the game.

In a two player game, each character must mess up 6 objects to win. In a three player game, 4 objects; and in a four player game, 3 objects.

To start, put together the 3D game board, put the neat sides of all the items into their respective slots on the game board. Put the Mom and Dad marker on the spot on the game board with the star. Select a Rugrat and place it in the playpen, then deal two cards to each player. The remaining cards form the draw deck.

On your turn, you roll the die.

If you roll a number:

- Move your Rugrat up to that number of spaces on the game board
- If you reach an object you have a card for place the card face up in front of you and flip the object to the messy side
- You do not have to land on the object by exact count
- If there's another Rugrat or Mom and Dad in your way, jump over that space (don't count it)

If you roll 'Draw':

Add a card from the draw pile to your hand.

If you roll 'Mom and Dad':

- Move Mom and Dad up to 6 spaces on the game board
- If Mom and Dad land on any Rugrat, send that Rugrat back to the playpen
- Mom and Dad can, like a Rugrat, ignore a Rugrat and not count a spot to travel farther on the board
- If Mom and Dad move onto a red dot space in front of one of the house items, they block any of the Rugrats from making a mess of that item until they are moved

From the back of the box:

All right, all you Rugrats, break out of the playpen. It’s time to turn the Pickles house upside down!

Race through the family’s kitchen, bathroom, living room… upstairs and downstairs on the 3-dimensional game board. And what do you do when you reach one of your objects? You turn it upside down!

Mom and Dad try to prevent the mess—but they can’t be everywhere at once. Sooner or later, you and the Rugrats turn the whole house upside down. What a mess you’ve made!
184199.name: Rugrats: Turn the House Upside Down

184200.name: The Way of Armor I (Alternate Archetypes)
184200.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue focuses on the Armor Master fighter archetype, applying its effects to five other classes including the barbarian, cavalier, inquisitor, paladin, and charger (a new base class introduced in issue #25). Sacrifices are made, but the benefits of mastering the second skin easily pays for itself in the heat of battle.

184201.name: Ticktock
184201.description:
From publisher blurb:

He deals in lead... Ticktock, the Clockwork Kid!

A Power Level 10 Rogue, Ticktock is a steampunk android with an itchy trigger finger. A perfect way to bring an "Old West" theme to your superhero campaign, Ticktock's favorite capers can be pulled right from your favorite western films! He also comes complete with a posse of robots he's roped into his gang, should you need a quick villain group for an episode. Ticktock the Clockwork Kid is an iconic figure in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Ticktock is designated "Blue" for his technological origins, as are the members of his Robot Roundup. This can make him a great nemesis for technological superheroes, but he can also be an ideal villain for western-themed heroes who need someone to indulge their quick-draw skill against! Steampunk-themed heroes will appreciate his motif, and if you have any robotic heroes on your team, they may see this villain as an ancestor of sorts! His "Old West" code makes him a memorable character for any campaign, and his robot nature means he can return to plague your heroes again and again.

184202.name: "S" is for "Support"
184202.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even Heroes Need Help

S is for Support looks at the supporting cast characters for superhero adventures and how they can play different roles in your Icons games, including:

Help around the heroes' headquarters from the Faithful Butler to the Reservist Heroes
Specialists from Costumers to Medical and Technical aides
Support within the law from the Police and Super-Agencies to Street Informants
The media, from Press Agents to Publishers and Reporters
Support for villains, from the Crime Doctor to the Toy Maker




Even the heroes need some help from time to time, so check out all of the support they can get!

184203.name: Pendragon
184203.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes what your campaign needs is a hero of legend, who everyone recognizes, even though they've never met her before.

Pendragon is one of the Great Heroes of WWII, a patriotic defender of justice and foe of tyranny, who survived decades in suspended animation to be revived in a world that more-than-ever needs a heroic role model!

184204.name: Alchemist
184204.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evil only darkens with age and this monster has been honing his craft for millenia. Immortal spellcaster and patron of countless other blackguards he helped into the business, the Alchemist considers himself the vilest villain ever to twirl a mustache or plot a nefarious scheme ... and he's going to do his best (or worst, as the case may be) to make sure your unlucky heroes share his opinion.

The Alchemist is a PL 14 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

184205.name: Airscape: The Fall of Gravity
184205.description:
User Summary

Airscape: The Fall of Gravity is a gravity-shifting platformer about a deep-sea octopus who has been kidnapped by a mechanical alien race.

184206.name: Mystic
184206.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Path of War continues onward!

Path of War Expanded is a series of releases to provide additional options for the martial system presented inPath of War.

Within the pages of this release, the mystic class and her support material are provided!

Within Path of War Expanded: Mystic, you will find:

The new mystic class, who fuses magical power into her martial abilities.
Four new martial disciplines - Elemental Flux, Mithral Current, Riven Hourglass, and Shattered Mirror
Two archetypes for the mystic - the aurora soul and the knight-chandler
Eight new feats for the mystic

184207.description:
Het Koninkrijk Dominion ("The Kingdom of Dominion") is an introductory version of Dominion. It contains 16 kingdom cards, and there are only 8 copies of each cards, instead of 10. Most of the cards come from Dominion and Dominion: Intrigue, but there are also cards from the other sets.

This game is good to get to know Dominion and makes it easy to learn, especially for smaller children.

Het Koninkrijk Dominion does not contain reaction cards, duration cards, curses or other cards with a lot of rules or confrontation.
184207.name: Het Koninkrijk Dominion

184208.name: Halo Spartan Strike
184208.description:
You are a Spartan supersoldier in this classified ONI simulation that starts during the events of Halo 2 on New Mombasa in 2552. Lead UNSC troops through numerous missions battling against new enemies to save Earth from being overtaken.

Source: The Game Website.

184210.description: These are metal coins from US edition of the game - 15 gold ones and 20 silver in one set. (The EU version of Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot has cardboard coins in the box.)
184210.name: Rattle, Battle, Grab the Loot: Metal Coins

184213.description:
Mamma Mia: Joker-Zutat is a promotional expansion for Mamma Mia consisting of 2 cards, given away for free at Stadt-Land-Spielt 2015.

The Joker-Zutat (wildcad ingredient) can be used as every ingredient.
It can be used with every Mamma Mia! or Sole Mio! game, but has a Mamma Mia!-backside.
184213.name: Mamma Mia: Joker-Zutat

184215.description:
Tutto: Sechsling-Karte expands Tutto! Volle Lotte (Fill or Bust).
The card counts 3000 points, if you set aside 6 dice with the same number.

It was given away for free on Stadt-Land-Spielt 2015, 2 cards each pack.
184215.name: Tutto: Sechsling-Karte

184216.name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 18
184216.description:
12 ASL scenarios

SP205: Mius Mischief
SP206: The Fraternal Grave
SP207: Resiste et Mords
SP208: Portomaggiore
SP209: Farmer's Market
SP210: Tea at Three
SP211: The Apiary
SP212: Merchant of Venice
SP213: The Mighty have Fallen
SP214: Makela's End
SP215: Encircle That!
SP216: Toothless Tiger

184217.name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 19
184217.description:
12 ASL scenarios

SP217 The Go Devils
SP218 Varosliget Park
SP219 Play Havoc
SP220 Hoepner's Edict
SP221 The Red Hammer
SP222 Ivan and the Three Bears
SP223 Road Warriors
SP224 The Crown of Thorn
SP225 Sunflowers Along the Kodyma
SP226 Grave Decision
SP227 Party Boys
SP228 Booster Shot

184219.name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 20
184219.description:
12 ASL scenarios

SP229 The Devil's Congregation
SP230 The Rimling Circus
SP231 Galician Persuasion
SP232 Easy Come Easy Go
SP233 The Krutoy Log Roll
SP234 Teltow Two-Step
SP235 Blue Ridger Blues
SP236 Hammer Time
SP237 Shanghai Scuffle
SP238 Inherent Systemic Violence
SP239 Nankai Shitai
SP240 Quiet Desperation

184222.description:
If you have first edition of Dice Brewing and you don't want to buy second edition of this game, but still you are interested in changes and new components, we have a special set of elements for you.
We have decided to prepare a Dice Brewing: Upgrade kit, where you can find 4 new player boards (bigger ones and with new rule about getting the blue die) and 3 sets of tokens. All new materials are high quality, well made (with exacly the same materials as basic, second edition of Dice Brewing) and of course they are an effect of players comments for the first edition of Dice Brewing.
184222.name: Dice Brewing: Upgrade Kit

184223.name: Drink-a-palooza
184223.description:
Drink-a-palooza is a party game that takes many common popular drinking games and puts them in a structure of a roll-and-move board game. The game is played on a Monopoly-style board, with player pieces as small six-packs. Players roll a die to move around the edge, and the space that the player lands on directs the player what to do. Depending on where you land, you will either play a group game such as high/low (card game that involves everyone playing) OR there are twelve bottle spaces on the map. The bottle spaces cause the players to play a mini-games of beer pong (throw a ping pong ball into a cup), quarters (bounce a quarter into a cup), or flip cup (flip a cup from right side up to upside down). If you win the mini-game, you receive a small plastic bottle to go in your six-pack. First player to six bottles wins the game.

From the publisher:

Drink-a-palooza is the ultimate drinking board game that mixes everyone’s favorite college drinking games & packs them into one dynamic competition. Whether you prefer beer, spirits, soda or water; you will love playing these games! This game eliminates the need for a large Ping-Pong table & makes for the perfect housewarming gift. "Pre-game" with drinkapalooza or take it to your buddy’s keg party. Get the bachelor & bachelorette party started & throw a killer “after party”. Drink-a-palooza board game takes your favorite games and makes them a thousand times tastier.

184224.name: Basic Pulp!
184224.description:
User summary:

Basic Pulp! is a roleplaying system that simulates the "two-fisted action" of pulp novels. The rules are complete within themselves, but are a modified implementation Dilly Green Bean Games' The Basic System. Some references to the source system appear in the rules.

Characters have nine Attributes with an "average human" having a score of 10 in each. Characters in the game have their scores determined by 3d6+2, giving them excellent performance. Attributes are combined into secondary characteristics called Statistics. Characters may also have legendary abilities, legendary faults, benefits, and/or legendary powers.

The system also uses skills and task groups, with ability derived from Attributes. Opposed actions are determined by combining a skill or task group performance level with a die roll and comparing the result to a target difficulty. Characters take damage in combat, but usually suffer only knockout so they can try again later. Characters advance in level by earning experience points.

184225.name: House of Reeds
184225.description:
From the game intro..

This is a role-playing game about a home. In this home lives a family, or a succession of families.

You’ll draw the home and watch as it changes with the family over the years. You will need a good-sized sheet of paper to draw on, pencils, and something on which to record characters (index cards are good).

A big pile of 10- sided dice is helpful but not necessary. You'll also need to print and cut out the game cards, or transcribe them onto something.

Additional user summary...

The players establish a setting (real or fantastic), an era, the kind of family unit that lives in the house, along with the house's architecture and location. Then Flavour Cards are chosen that tweak the session's theme.

Players then take turns drawing in rooms of the house and give them a purpose, vibe, view, etc. Each player then creates a member of the family that initially inhabits the house.

As play commences players take turns narrating scenes of life in the house. Each scene takes place in a particular room, which includes a description of how the room has now changed in some way.

Families members age and eventually (perhaps) the original family moves away and the house gets a new family.

The game ends by player agreement.

184226.description: Packs of dice sold by the publisher to expand Tumblin' Dice player color options. Ferti offers cloth bags of 2 sets of dice. Eagle-Gryphon offers individual dice sets. Each set consists of the 4 dice needed to replace a main dice set from Tumblin' Dice.
184226.name: Tumblin' Dice: Additional Dice Packs

184227.name: Inherent Advancement
184227.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Inherent Advancement is a system to help declutter any Pathfinder campaign, whether or not you are using the mythic rules. In a single page, it presents a simple, easy-to-use mechanism to eliminate boring magic items and create more rewarding rewards that reside with the character rather than their gear. The system scales with level and offers advice on concentrating the value of magical items to make them more memorable, as well as the option of substituting mythic advancement for bulk treasure placement. The next time you shake your head at characters decked out like Christmas trees with "Big Six" bonus items, consider picking up Inherent Advancement and giving it a try instead.

Mythic Minis are short, inexpensive products designed to take one rules concept or set of Pathfinder RPG rules and bring them to you in a new way for the mythic rules, including converting existing rules as well as introducing entirely new rule options. Created by the same designers that helped bring you the official mythic rules, Mythic Minis skip the fluff and give you all crunch, all the time.

Nobody knows mythic like Legendary Games, and whether it's new mythic feats, class abilities, path abilities, magic items, or anything else, every Mythic Mini delivers a delicious dollop of dazzling design that will fill out your mythic experience one slice at a time. Check for a new Mythic Mini every Monday to make your game just a little more Legendary!

184228.name: Manuel du Gendarme et du Voleur
184228.description:
From the introduction:

Bernard & Jean est une adaptation française et humoristique des aventures télévisuelles de Starsky et Hutch.

User summary:

Manuel du Gendarme et du Voleur ("Manual of Cops and Robbers") presents the basic rules of Advanced Bernard & Jean. After explaining the concepts behind role playing, the manual explains the character creation process. Characters have basic attributes, skills, talents, and a profession. The manual then presents the basic scenario--the cops (good guys) must hunt down and arrest the robbers (bad guys), being careful to follow the law (at least in loose interpretation). Once arrested, the robbers must be questioned to elicit a confession.

The rules, especially the skills and talents, are strongly skewed to create scenes of comic humor based on slapstick behavior and untenable situations. One rule is that all the rules should be consumed with moderation.

In the game, the law is enshrined in The Penal Code which has sixteen inviolate articles, which include things such as not drinking "too much", getting to work on time, saying hello to the Police Chief every morning, turning the lights off when leaving the bathroom, and looking coiffed and composed on the streets.

The "Booklet" and the "eBook" versions are identical except for the pagination--the "Booklet" version is paginated for double-sided print and fold; the "eBook" version is paginated in order for on-screen reading.

184229.name: Vier im Zoo
184229.description:
At the zoo are lots of animals to see, but after we see them once, will we find them again? Do we know where all the animals are hiding?

In Vier im Zoo, first the cards are laid out face up, then after all players have had a look at the cards, they are turned face down. Starting clockwise, each player takes a turn shaking the wooden disc inside the cover, then trying to find the corresponding animal card. Whoever is first to find four animals wins!

184230.name: Manuel du Meneur de Jeu
184230.description:
User summary:

Manuel du Meneur de Jeu ("Playmaker Manual") presents the basic mechanics of Advanced Bernard & Jean with hints on running a game and a campaign. It was the original rulebook and is augmented (not supplanted) by the later Manuel du Gendarme et du Voleur.

The rules are strongly skewed to create scenes of comic humor based on slapstick behavior and untenable situations. The core opposed effort resolution process, for example, favors indifferent results. Combat is not particularly lethal, but does result in an unusually high number of impacts to embarrassing body parts. Adventures are constructed to make life difficult for the characters--they can easily resolve situations only if they are willing to violate The Penal Code (which they cannot do).

The "Booklet" and the "eBook" versions are identical except for the pagination--the "Booklet" version is paginated for double-sided print and fold; the "eBook" version is paginated in order for on-screen reading. The electronic version contents are identical to the 1995 print version.

184231.name: Livret d'Enquête
184231.description:
User summary:

Livret d'Enquête (Inquiry Booklet) presents several adventure areas, settings, scenes, and non-player criminals to use in Advanced Bernard & Jean. The situations and characters are inspired by the television series Starsky and Hutch.

The booklet was bundled with three sheets of maps.

The "Booklet" and the "eBook" versions are identical except for the pagination--the "Booklet" version is paginated for double-sided print and fold; the "eBook" version is paginated in order for on-screen reading.

184232.name: Casier Judiciaire
184232.description:
Casier Judiciaire ("Criminal Record") is an extended character record for a criminal in Advanced Bernard & Jean. The layout is presented as a Ministère de l'Intérieur form, with a front and profile photograph, name, details, distinguishing marks, and so forth. At six pages, it contains rather more data than a typical character "sheet".

It is complemented by the Livret du Gendarme, which records details for a policeman and his missions.

184233.name: Formulaire A32
184233.description: Formulaire A32 révisé 1952 Version 2.5 wc ("Form A32") is an extended record for a police action in Advanced Bernard & Jean. The layout is presented as a Ministère de la Défense form of the Gendarmerie Nationale. At four pages, it contains details about an adventure, like a traditional "after action" report.

184234.name: Livret du Gendarme
184234.description:
Livret du Gendarme ("Policeman Booklet") is an extended character record for a policeman in Advanced Bernard & Jean. At six pages, it contains rather more data than a typical character "sheet", with space for details on vehicles, contacts, and events.

It is complemented by the Casier Judiciaire, which records details for a criminal.

184235.name: Yellow Tome: Beyond the Mists
184235.description:
User summary:

Yellow Tome: Beyond the Mists (often Beyond the Mists) is a medieval fantasy roleplaying game with well-developed rules that favor realism and complexity over rapid play. The rules are presented in HTML only and the layout is quite fragmented, leading to numerous links required to follow any rule.

The main page presents four major topics, namely: Character Generation, Skill Lists, Magic and Miracles, and Combat and Equipment. Each of these major topics then leads to multiple sub-topics, most of which lead to further entries.

Character creation is complex and math intensive. Characters have multiple attributes (intelligence, wisdom, constitution, strength, dexterity, speech, appearance, art, ethics, faith, etc.), some of which are scored by distributing a pool of 60 points, and some of which are randomized. Secondary traits (class, gender, race, size, horoscope, social status, etc.) are either selected or generated based on attributes or random rolls.

Skills are then selected with skills being accessed via skill clusters, available only to some classes. Skills are further distinguished by the cluster which granted access and by the method of study yielding proficiency in the skill.

Spells (magic or miracles) are categorized into several casting methods and are created through a specific spell skill (of which there are nine, roughly aligning with "schools of magic"). Each spell skill grants tentative access to an exclusive spell list. Spells are assigned a difficulty depending on effect, as well as a fatigue value for depleting character spell power.

Combat is resolved with the aid of a large array of matrices, each one devoted to weapons of a similar type (e.g., heavy impact weapons, light piercing weapons, etc.), cross-indexed with opponent's armor class to yield both "to hit" modifiers and damage ranges. Character hit points are divided among six body areas (head, chest, right arm, etc.) and damage is influenced by armor type at that body location. The game enumerates an exhaustive list of weapons and armors.

184236.name: YT40CHAR.xls - Character Generation Spreadsheet
184236.description:
User summary:

YT40CHAR.xls is an Excel spreadsheet that combines user entered data and programmed formulas and selection lists to partially automate the quite complex process of character creation in Yellow Tome: Beyond the Mists. When utilized the resulting sheet is printable and usable as a basic text-only character sheet.

The spreadsheet does numeric calculations and does offer some selection lists but it does not enforce most rules. Further, it does not incorporate all of the most-recent changes to the rules. A separate section notes a few basic build errors, notable when allocated pool points exceed limits.

The spreadsheet is available for download from the same site that provides the HTML rules.

184237.name: Ages of Alivena: The Basics
184237.description:
Publisher Blurb

Ages of Alivena is the premier quick-start, easy to learn, pen and paper role-playing game. It is specifically tailored to make it easy for new players to get started, whether questing or GM-ing, while still providing enough depth for those who want to delve deep into the untold chapters of history from the vast ages of Alivena.

This book contains all you need to start playing.

184238.name: & (Issue 12 - Fall 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Can't Remember The Name, But The Fangs Look Familiar
A Fighter, Magic-User, & Cleric Walk Into A Bar
Hex Crawls: North Hills and Northride Regions
One Page Dungeon: A Dire Need
Spell Caster's Paradise I: Illusionist Spells
Spell Caster's Paradise II: Cleric Spells
The Brewmaster: Monsters As Playable Race
The Gaming Gourmet: Leftover Brunswick Stew
184238.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Featured in this issue: Inns, Taverns, & Way Stations!

This issue includes

Ecology of the Lonely Inn
Knights of the Hallowed Grave
The Tavern of Whyestill Cross
A Fighter, Magic-User, & Cleric Walk Into A Bar
Featured Fiction: Amalric’s Shrine

Plus some bonus articles

Faerie Society
Can’t Remember The Name, But The Fangs Look Familiar
Leomund’s Long Coats
The Need for Speed
Amedio Vampire
Monsters As Playable Race
One Page Dungeon: A Dire Need …

And the usual columns ….

184239.name: Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die
rpg: Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die
184239.description:
Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die is a generic roleplaying system that uses a single mechanic to resolve all opposed actions. The mechanic is somewhat unique in that is uses a stripped standard deck of playing cards and a miniature "one hand" card game for resolution.

Character creation is very simple and primarily narrative. Characters have only one type of statistic, called a Trait. Traits represent things like skills, professions, or talents. Sample traits would be: hacking, fortune telling, investigator, assassin, clever, strong, or vicious). Characters can have multiple traits with score ranging from 1 to 5 (2 is considered "normal"). Characters also have a "trump" suit, representing their best type of traits. Optionally, characters have "karma" points that allow narrative revision when expended (a type of "safety net").

During resolution, each opponent identifies a relevant trait and draws a number of cards corresponding to that trait. A card is then played (or a set or a straight, if drawn) and the opponent must counter each card by beating it. Sets give "Slams" and straights give "Combos", both yielding excellent results.

Aside from the mechanics, the site also provides a list of adventure hooks, an assortment of "goons" to thwart the players, a character sheet, an example of play, and an optional system of talents and flaws. A character creation guide also is provided.

184240.name: Erebus: A Primer for New Visitors to the City of Shadows
rpg: Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die
184240.description:
User summary:

Erebus is a setting developed especially for Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die. It is built around the these of action and intrigue. Set in a Victorian, steampunkish world, magicians, gunslingers, lycanthropes, and politicians all share the area as they view for power.

The Primer is an HTML document that provides a basic walk through of the setting, including geography, history, and notable locales.

184241.name: Erebus: The Herald
rpg: Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die
184241.description:
User summary:

Erebus is a setting developed especially for Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die. It is built around the these of action and intrigue. Set in a Victorian, steampunkish world, magicians, gunslingers, lycanthropes, and politicians all share the area as they view for power.

The Herald is an HTML document that mimics a newspaper, presenting game information in the form of news stories. The document details nine major power centers in the city, describing their structure, goals, and methods of operation.

184242.name: Erebus: Excerpts from the Journal of Natural Philosophy
rpg: Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die
184242.description:
User summary:

Erebus is a setting developed especially for Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die. It is built around the these of action and intrigue. Set in a Victorian, steampunkish world, magicians, gunslingers, lycanthropes, and politicians all share the area as they view for power.

Excerpts from the Journal of Natural Philosophy is an HTML document that mimics a periodical of a scientific body. The document presents three main topics: a philosophical explanation of magic, an examination of shapeshifters, and an interview with a member of a secretive organization of warrior-monks.

184243.name: Erebus: Archive of Ereban Culture and Mythology
rpg: Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die
184243.description:
User summary:

Erebus is a setting developed especially for Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die. It is built around the these of action and intrigue. Set in a Victorian, steampunkish world, magicians, gunslingers, lycanthropes, and politicians all share the area as they view for power.

The Archive of Ereban Culture and Mythology is an HTML document that presents two major topics. The first is a segment of fiction that was serialized (e.g., incomplete), and the second is an account of werewolf behavior including hunting tactics.

184244.name: Erebus: Definitive Guide to Entertainment in the City of Shadows
rpg: Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die
184244.description:
User summary:

Erebus is a setting developed especially for Blur: The Hand is Quicker than the Die. It is built around the these of action and intrigue. Set in a Victorian, steampunkish world, magicians, gunslingers, lycanthropes, and politicians all share the area as they view for power.

The Definitive Guide to Entertainment in the City of Shadows is an HTML document that presents setting information and suggestions for game masters. Optional rules for fighting styles are provided, as are additional weapons. Seven templates for character creation are detailed, and an HTML character sheet also is provided.

184245.name: Space Junkers
184245.description:
Space is a hard place and making a bit of scratch out here is even harder. Racing against fellow scavengers you must reach derelict ships and earn enough cash to buy your way out of this long, harsh and tedious life!

In Space Junkers, 2-4 players compete to grab fuel cells and spend them to reach derelict ships. Players roll dice and place them on fuel cell cards in order to outbid or block their opponents. Valuable fuel cells are used to buy derelict ships, earning victory points. The first to 12 points has collected enough from the derelict ships to move on to a better life. May the best salvage company win!

184246.name: Snog Marry Shove
184246.description:
An adult board game.

The game of impossible choices and hilarious results. 3 famous names; 3 hard choices. Who to Snog. Who to Marry. Who to Shove. Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu, Cameron Diaz, Enrique Iglesias, Antonio Banderas, Ricky Martin. Decisions, decisions! It's hard enough trying to decide what you'd do, let alone guess what everyone else is thinking. there are hot seat question cards for you to make up your own choices - family, friends, work mates, ex-boyfriends, ex-girlfriends, or, if you're really daring, your fellow players! The winner is the first to get to the finish (and is still talking to their partner!)

184247.name: EXO
184247.description:
EXO is a universe exploration game for 1-4 players. The players take part in a journey using the first version of a warp drive. The goal is to travel star systems in distant galaxies and bring home discoveries in the form of knowledge, exolife, exosubstances, and Zero-G product items. The more you bring home and the more variety there is in what you bring home, the more glory you receive. Whoever has the most glory wins.

The prototype-grade warp drive in your mothership is effective but hard to steer, making you part explorer and part test pilot on your brave journey into the unknown. You all travel by jumping between galaxies together in a convoy that's connected to a mothership where the warp drive is. About nine months elapse on each star system visited, separated into three turns. In each star system, you travel individually and compete to make discoveries that generate glory. At the end of the year at each star system, the warp drive tries to jump back to earth. If it is successful, the game ends and you make the final scoring; otherwise you spend about three months warp-travelling and end up in another star system, where you collect more discoveries.

184248.description: Sheep Happens is a look into a ridiculous world where incredibly dumb sheep will have to figure out how to save themselves from the angriest, craziest, and most bizarre goats you've ever seen. A card game where you need to steal and imprison enemy players sheep, using powerful and dumb goats to attack them, while you defend yours. Defend from your opponents attacks placing fences in front of your sheep, using traps or scrolls from your hand and If you have any goat cards in your hand, attack your opponents in order to capture as many sheep as you can. Each captured sheep is worth one point, and the first player to reach seven, five or three points, wins the game.
184248.name: Sheep Happens

184249.name: FILD: Renegade Monster
184249.description:
User Summary

Set in a mildly scary universe, with creepy monsters and subtly chilling music, FILD: Renegade Monsters is aimed at the whole family. It is an easy-to-learn but hard-to-master territory conquest game. Children as young as four will pick up quickly on the intuitive gameplay, while seasoned board gamers will develop complex strategies to master this option-rich game, which has a skill-to-chance balance similar to that of Backgammon.

Players embody the mighty spirits of Flora, Ice, Lava, and Desert. They fight for territory with the help of Zombies, Phantoms, Vampire Ladies, and other disloyal monsters. Each field has the colour of the monster placed on it. Monsters change colour when a monster of their family, but of a different colour, is placed next to them. Turn-by-turn territories expand, change sides, or are fenced off. At the end of the game, the player with the most and largest territories wins.

184250.name: Nextbol
184250.description:
The game consists of 2 items: poles and balls.The balls’ holes are the connection point of the items. Each of the 2 players picks a colour with its 44 items: 12 balls and 32 poles.

RULES FOR 2 PLAYERS

The game starts with the player who selects the white items. The player can choose to start with a pole or a ball. Each player plays their turn using only one item at a time: a pole or a ball.
Every piece played must be linked to the pieces played beforehand. As the poles are inserted in the ball holes a three dimensional figure will begin to form. Once an item is placed, no changes or modification can be made.

AIM OF THE GAME
A player wins the game if during their turn they manage to:
• Insert 3 poles more than their opponent in any played ball
or
• place in a straight line 4 balls of the same colour.

Given that each ball has 6 holes and each player wins by placing 3 poles of the same colour more than their opponent the winning possibilities are 3-0 or 4-1. The players build up a three-dimensional network where there are different diagonals (2D or 3D) that allow placing 4 balls of the same colour in line. The game is considered a draw when both players use up their pieces and no player can place 3 poles more than their opponent into a ball or 4 balls of the same colour in line. Positioning and placing the pieces of the game in a clever way is part of the winning strategy.

In order to create a solid structure and to minimise the risk of the structure breaking during the game, we suggest placing the poles firmly in the ball holes.

RULES FOR 4 PLAYERS
The same rules for 2 players apply. Pairs of 2 players start the game with 44 elements each, playing on alternate turns and interposing one player of each couple.

184251.name: 3 Monkeys
184251.description: 3 Monkeys is a party game in which player must make static mime of various emotions - fear, hunger, ambition, greed, despair... - with their face. Every round, a player must mime three emotions - one with hand over ears, one with hand over eyes, and the last one with hands over mouth. It's not always that easy...

184252.name: Mission Chicago
184252.description:
Publisher Blurp

Chicago. Eine Stadt mit düsterer Geschichte. Hier tobte der letzte Kampf gegen die Universelle Bruderschaft. Hier stellte sich die Metamenschheit der vernichtenden Plage der Insektengeister. Hier griff man zu einer nuklearen Sprengung als letzten Ausweg. Jahrzehnte später hat Chicago sich immer noch nicht erholt. In der Stadt herrscht das Gesetz des Stärkeren. Neue und versteckte Schaben und Wespen-Nester formen sich im Untergrund und in den Ruinen von Downtown. Nuyen zählen auf den Straßen weniger als eine geladene Waffe und ein paar Medikamente zum Tausch. Und in den Außenbezirken etablieren sich die Großkonzerne, um mit ihren geheimen Experimenten den größtmöglichen Profit aus der vergangenen Katastrophe und den unzähmbaren Insektengeistern zu schlagen.


Additional Information

Collects three Shadowrun Missions adventures (SRM 5A-01 Chasin' the Wind, SRM 5A-02 Critic's Choice, SRM 5A-03 Gone long gone) and a description of the city of Chicago.

184253.name: Elder Sign: Arkham Nights 2015 Promotional Ancient One Card
184253.description:
A new, official, Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 9-10 October 2015.

Consists of Ubbo-Sathla, a new Ancient One.

184255.name: Bloodborne: The Old Hunters
videogamehonor: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best DLC/Expansion of the Year Nominee
videogamecompilation: Bloodborne Game of the Year Edition
184255.description:
User Summary

Set in a nightmare world where hunters from the past are trapped forever. There are new stages, rewards, beasts, outfits, and weapons as well as additional magic. There will be new story details and new NPCs.

184256.description:
Eclipse: Black Hole is a mini-expansion for Eclipse that consists of two black hole hexes and a flux wormhole discovery tile. During set-up, shuffle one of the black hole hexes with the other Outer Sector hexes. When a ship lands on the black hole, roll a die to determine whether the ship returns to play immediately (and takes one damage) or returns to play after 1-2 rounds. When the ship returns to play, it comes back on any Inner Sector hex or any hex with at least one wormhole pointing to empty space, with the effect dependent on which black hole hex is in the game.

With the flux wormhole discovery tile, you can place it on the edge between any two hexes to connect them with a full wormhole, thereby making each of them worth one extra VP at game's end.
184256.name: Eclipse: Black Hole

184257.name: Gravity Rush Remastered
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Joystick PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
184257.description:
User Summary

Gravity Rush Remastered comes with an improved HD version of the main game and all three DLC packs: Spy Pack, Maid Pack, and The Military Pack. Runs in full HD 1080p with ample graphical and performance improvements.

184258.name: Rocket Shogi
184258.description:
Rocket Shogi is a stand-alone small board (5x7 grid, with 8 pieces per player) Shogi variant. Unusually, it uses all standard Shogi piece types except for pawns.

It can be played using standard Shogi pieces.

It is also included as a second independent game (using its own board and pieces) with Simple Shogi in a combined package sold under the title "Simple Shogi".

184259.name: Hauptman Klaue
184259.description:
From publisher blurb:

"TO RESIST MEIN OFERLORDS IS AN EXCERSISE IN FUTILITY!!"

A relic of WWI and WWII, Hauptman Klaue (PL 10) has returned to a world he no longer recognizes. His homeland has forsaken the Nazi Reich, so he must use his genius and his technology to realize the Fuhrer's original genocidal vision. Slowly, methodically, he maneuvers his Overlords into place. One day, he will destroy his hated Allied foe, Pendragon, and put this world into his own twisted view of order!

184260.name: Tricky Pirates
boardgameversion: Noisy Andrews' print and play version
184260.description:
Tricky Pirates is a trick-taking, area control game. Players play cards in tricks that allow them to move their own pirate loaded ships, stab opposing pirates, or sink opposing ships. Pirates in ships fight for control over treasure kept on five islands. But watch out, pirate ships work on wind power and the wind will not always blow your way.

At the beginning of the game, the treasure on the islands is bonuses and play effects. But very quickly it becomes doubloons. The player that controls three islands worth of doubloons at the end of a trick wins.

184261.name: Hybrid Class Pulverizer
184261.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Hybrid Class for your game!

The pulverizer is a barbaric martial artist who specializes in smashing his foes and using their crumpled bodies as weapons!

Included

The Pulverizer Hybrid class: a mix of the Unchained Barbarian and Brawler
Almost a dozen rage powers usable by any class that uses rage.
and more!




This product is included in Hybrid Classes Vol. I

184262.name: The Lure of Venus
184262.description:
From publisher blurb:

Venus. The Emerald Planet. A planet of unimaginable wealth, power, freedom, fame, adventure, immortality. Can you escape its lure or will you fall victim to its dangers?

The steamy jungles of Venus hide all manner of mysteries – and dangers – beneath their thick canopies, from ancient cities to deadly flora and fauna. Explorers look to penetrate their shady depths while corporations seek to exploit the bounty of the Ishtar Range, something the natives Venusians will savagely resist.

The Lure of Venus contains a complete gazetteer of the alien world, including an in-depth look at Venusian Concordats as well as the planet’s many colonies. There’s also a look at the savage Venusians’ high-tech forebears, the Erisians, and all manner of nasty wildlife, new equipment, occupations and more besides.

Can our heroes survive Venus, or will they be lost forever in its jungles?

In this book you will find:

A guide to the planet, each location accompanied with an interesting character and loads of story hooks to inspire your own adventures.
A look at the Venusians themselves, with a guide to each of the concordats, their appearance, society, religion and technology, as well as character hooks to inspire players’ backgrounds.
Background on the secret societies, cults and lodges of the Venusians, from the Cult of the Fanged Mother to the Soviet-backed People’s Army of Venus, including character packages for players.
A glimpse at those outsiders who seek out wealth, power or fame on Venus, from the US Marines of Camp Butler to the exiled Martians of Tamatha, each with character and story hooks aplenty.
New creatures, from the lizard-like primates known as the Howling Death to the evocatively named Spiny Gobblers.
A complete adventure, The Downey Creek War.
New character traits, from Battle Cry to Smooth Talker, equipment from the Ladite Radium Sword to the Grathik War Lance, and occupational packages from Big Game Hunter to Storm Rider.

184263.name: Pulp Fantastic Adventure Generator
184263.description:
From publisher blurb:

You just bought Pulp Fantastic, and you need a quick adventure for tonight's game. What do you do, of course you buy this handy pulp adventure generator, loaded with tons of suggestions where you are able to engage in hours of fun.

184264.name: BODGERS: Basic One-Dice Gloranthan Epic Roleplaying System
rpg: BODGERS: Basic One-Dice Gloranthan Epic Roleplaying System
184264.description:
User summary:

BODGERS: Basic One-Dice Gloranthan Epic Roleplaying System attempts to retain the RuneQuest tone and feel while replacing the RuneQuest mechanics with streamlined and simplified mechanics. The rules are limited to a discussion of the replacement mechanics and assume external sources will be used to provide the setting of Glorantha. As the replacement mechanics are themselves quite complex, the success of the effort is dubious.

Characters have several types of attributes, called "Statistics". They are arranged into four groups of three attributes, namely: Graces (Appearance, Dexterity, Voice); Physical (Constitution, Size, Strength); Senses (Hearing, Sight, Taste and Smell); and Mystical (ESP, Intuition, Power). The values for each attribute are determined by either point distribution or random rolls. Modifiers based on race, social background, and role also are provided.

Characters also have several "Derived Statistics" that are created from formulas based on attributes. These derived values include: Charisma, Evade, Melee, Missile, Damage Modifier, Hit Points, Magic Points, Encumbrance Allowance, and Movement Rate.
