Characters have some combination of skills, derived from a standard list of seventeen normal skills and seven magic skills. Most skill values start at zero. Skills and Statistics may be increased by experience, training, or research; Derived Statistics change relative to Statistics changes.

Combat allows for variable damage, parries, and damage absorption by armor. Critical hits are allowed, as are combat fumbles. A variety of combat options are supported, including defensive fighting, double attacks, evasion, and passive shield use. Wounds received may be minor, major, or critical, each level with various penalties.

Spell casting involves manipulation of numerous variables, including duration, intensity, multiple casting and range. Thirty-two magic spells are provided. Divine magic is less developed. Ritual magic is presented with some development, but remains fairly vague.

The rules also include a concise process for converting RuneQuest characters to the system.

184265.name: Mafia Casino: Henchmen Extension
184265.description:
A group of men and women with special talents have been summoned in Mafia Casino: Henchmen Extension, and they are ready to do whatever it takes to help the Godfather in his race for wealth.

This expansion includes a new Mission, a new game of chance, additional cards and poker chips, and many optional rule variants that will challenge you and your entire family to discover who will best navigate the world of Mafia Casino!

184266.description:
Welcome to Banana Republic, a political unstable country where the economy is controlled by political and business elites. You are one of the elite of this nation, and your objective is to stash enough money in an offshore trust fund that you can retire comfortably. Invest your income in stocks, properties and bonds, then exert influence on the government to manipulate the economy for your personal gain. Orchestrate the downfall of other elites by destroying their personal life through car accidents, expensive divorces, and shotgun babies. Do you have what it takes to survive in this cutthroat world of money mania?

Wongamania: Banana Economy is an economic and modern finance board game that reflects the complexity of modern investment portfolio management by incorporating multiple asset classes that behave differently under different economic situations. Deviating from the traditional auction mechanisms used by most stock-trading board games, Wongamania: Banana Economy uses a combination of resource management, environment manipulation, and take-that mechanisms to reflect the brutal competition and uncertainty of the modern global financial markets. Players have to manage a portfolio of stocks, properties and bonds, and assess the risk-reward of holding them in different allocations. Players are also able to influence the economic environment by manipulating it to either benefit their personal investment allocation or to wreck havoc against other players who are using a different asset allocation strategy. Players are also able to make use of their money for other purposes, such as sabotaging the personal lives of other players, hiring professionals to disrupt the strategy of other players and buying insurance to protect against sabotages. Whoever stashes enough money in a off-shore trust fund wins the game.

Wongamania: Banana Economy is a reimplementation of the 2014 game Wongamania (only available in SEA), and multiple changes have been made to cater better to the international audience.
184266.name: Wongamania: Banana Economy

184267.name: On Mars
184267.description:
1. In 2025 the first settlers arrived on Mars! The first small colonies were developed and 10 years later a group of very powerful space exploration companies established a major colony ruled by a terrestrial organization. The OMDE (Organization for Mars Development and Exploration).

2. The currency for this colonies was not established yet but the most usual and valuable currency was a kind of condensed energy called Power Cells.

3. As an astronaut from a private space exploration company, you want to be the pioneer in developing the most advanced and biggest colony on Mars, achieving the OMDE goals as well as your company hidden agenda.

4. By providing and managing settlers you will explore, mine, build, power and upgrade buildings.

5. You will lead the construction and assembling of farm domes, water compounds and power generators.

6. You will build and develop Rovers and Spaceships to mine Mars moons and the asteroid belt. This will grant you the precious Ore needed to build and improve your colony.

7. Trade or buy in small black-markets both locally and on Earth.

8. And finally become auto-sufficient and free from any terrestrial organization.

Do you dare to be part of mankind’s next biggest conquest?
Grab yourself a piece of it.

The game starts with a small colony and a few buildings already built, like the O2 factory, shelters, a generator, a farm and a water compound.

The game is played in turns using different phases:
Players decide which OMDE goals will be part of the game, how the new settlers from earth will be distributed through the different colonies and which community buildings and materials Earth needs to authorize and provide.

Players dispute with each other a limited set of actions they can take in their turn and the raw materials sent from Earth.
In turn order players take the actions, but they need careful planning, builds consume power and a second building may not be placed before a generator is upgraded.

Finally, all the Colony parameters are adjusted.

An auction will decide the paths of the players in game. The goals in play are different in every game as such the strategies pursued by players will also necessarily have to be different.

Actions may be: to build/upgrade buildings, rovers or ships, to produce, to trade, to explore, to develop.
Actions have the form of cards to upgrade buildings, tokens, tiles or just the adjustment of a cube.

All actions have an energy cost, so upgrading the generators and the existent power grid is very important. At the same time most of the buildings need Ore to be built, energy, people and O2 to run. Settlers need food, water and shelter to be able to survive.

Food, water and O2 needs to be stored. If you can't store enough supplies, population will not grow and eventually die.

The game can be played with different goals varying the time of play from 60 min (beginner) to 180 min (experts).

184268.name: Darkly Through the Labyrinth
184268.description:
(publisher blurb)

In the 1980s, a moral panic swept the United States. Rumors swirled of a vast underground network of devil worshippers, and claims of Satanic Ritual Abuse flooded the airwaves. Role-playing games were gateways to black magic, and backwards messages, hidden in heavy metal music, spurred teenagers to Satanism or suicide. The devil was everywhere and something needed to be done. In response to growing public fears, the FBI assembled a taskforce to investigate occult activity.

Darkly Through the Labyrinth is a role-playing game where players assume the roles of FBI agents assigned to this special taskforce. They investigate doomsday cults, fringe religious groups, and ritualistic crimes. Darkly Through the Labyrinth is a horror game, but the monsters are human. The evils perpetrated upon society are entirely manmade; there is no supernatural agency at work. The enemy is one of us.

184269.name: The Universe
184269.description:
Space-themed, dexterity luck, skill, strategy game using dice, marbles and discs. Its bocci ball, bowling, shuffle board, craps, pool, and a little bit of monopoly.

Players send out their ships by flicking and rolling from cornered docks. The objective is to land on the positive spaces, ring bearers or the black hole with your disks. Watch out for negatives and the black hole with your marble and dice.

Defense is also allowed if you can hit your opponents ships with yours. Setting a round maximum, the player with highest points at the end of the set round wins. You can actually win by losing in this game. Simple to learn and competitive to play.

184270.name: Destiny: The Taken King
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best PS4 Game Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Persistent Game of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Action Game of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Sound Design of the Year Nominee
184270.description:
Destiny: The Taken King, the next great adventure in the first person shooter Destiny universe, introduces a new story campaign and quests, new enemies to fight, new locations to explore, new Strikes and Crucible maps, a new Raid that will put players to the ultimate test, and more.

Source: The Game Website.

184271.name: Dropsy
184271.description:
After a deadly circus fire shatters his world and tarnishes his name, Dropsy the Clown finds himself on a journey of self-discovery through a story that harnesses powerful themes of love and unmerited kindness. With his father gravely ill and the world turning its back on the once celebrated clown, Dropsy will need to help those in need, hug total strangers, and unearth dark secrets on the winding road to redemption. Oh, and Dropsy can also talk to animals.

Dropsy is a non-traditional take on the classic point and click adventure formula starring the game's perpetually carefree namesake clown as he explores a richly detailed world full of colorful characters and sinister secrets, doling out hugs along the way. Rather than lead players on a singular narrative path, players are free to choose which avenues of adventure they want to explore in an open world setting and can piece the puzzles and story together however they choose.

Source: The Game Website.

184272.name: SWODES: Star Wars One-Dice Epic System
rpg: SWODES: Star Wars One-Dice Epic System
184272.description:
SWODES: Star Wars One-Dice Epic System, seeks to simplify the mechanics presented in West End Games' Star Wars RPG by replacing the core d6 mechanic with a single d10 roll. The game itself is heavily reliant on the West End Games product, referring most character creation rules, statistics, and skills to that product. A rule for converting West End Games' Star Wars characters' d6 dice pools to SWODES skill modifiers is presented. Aside from this core replacement, there is little original material in this rule set.

Character skills in SWODES are represented by a single number (-1 to 48), which is the target number that must be rolled under for success. Note the d10 roll is scored zero through nine (not one through ten). The die roll has situational modifiers applied by GM fiat.

A final comment gives hints on how standard adventures, settings, and other products can be adapted to SWODES.

184273.name: Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime
videogamehonor: 2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Debut Game of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Honorable Mention
2016 SXSW Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
184273.description:
Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime is a frantic 1- or 2-player couch co-op action space shooter set in a massive neon battleship. Only through teamwork can you triumph over the evil forces of Anti-Love, rescue kidnapped space-bunnies, and avoid a vacuumy demise. Deep space is a dangerous place, but you don’t have to face it alone!

2 players, or 1 player plus a loyal AI space-pet, need to work together to man the different battle stations, dashing back and forth between weapons, shields and engines. Both players fill important roles at all times, and nobody gets left behind.

Source: The Game Website.

184274.name: Breaking the Ice (Playtest Version)
184274.description:
From the introduction:

Breaking the Ice - A roleplaying game of intimate differences

Go on a Date Tonight! Breaking the Ice is a two player role-playing game. Play a pair of characters going out on their first three dates. Explore what it's like to fumble through those first impressions, feel the spark of attraction and discover common ground that will (hopefully) bring your
characters together. And do this from a slightly different viewpoint than your own...

User summary:

The playtest version of the game was distributed freely on the internet 2004-05. The rules are presented in HTML and PDF format, with a provided character sheet. The playtest version varies from the final, published version primarily in formatting, copyediting, and clarifications. The playtest version is somewhat less flexible in character creation.

184275.description:
September 22nd, 1935: “We’ve been successfully completing expeditions to the Tomb for generations, however in all of my years of experience, I’ve never witnessed challenges like these!. I’ve been to the Tomb more than anyone else, and I’ve survived more than you could imagine; from supernatural otherworldly beings of awe-striking power, to power hungry fascists, to beasts of myth and stories of old. I’ve held in my hands priceless artifacts, as well as the heads of my dying brothers and sisters. We were given a mission, one that we felt confident we could achieve. But when we got to the Tomb ... Nothing could have prepared us for what happened next...”

Mission Briefing: The previous quote was taken from a
veteran adventurer that attempted an elite mission...
Proceed with caution!

Secrets of the Lost Tomb: The Elite Missions, adds a whole new level of depth and challenge to the already Epic experience. Fun to play and simple to add, players are able to use one or more Elite Mission cards to overlay any existing Secrets of the Lost Tomb scenario. Contained within this special expansion are 12 Elite Missions to choose from, each with a diverse storyline and deadly consequence. Many will attempt these missions, few will survive... will you?
184275.name: Secrets of the Lost Tomb: The Elite Missions

184276.name: Autopista
184276.description:
Different preconditions and as many surprises and incidents enliven this race of wedding guests. While playing, you are exercised in knowledge and mastery of the most fundamental rules of the road.

Each player has a rental car. With it, he must transfer the members of a family to a wedding. Before picking up passengers, the driver must prove their condition by examination. Only then you can go pick up the various family members.

The driver must also buy a gift. When all requirements are exceeded, each driver must try to get the first to the wedding. But along the way not only must observe all traffic rules, but also be able to make money in various ways. Only when you have 100,000 in cash you can reach the finish line as winner.

184277.name: Casus Belli (v4, Issue 13 - Jan/Feb 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Alliances: mon royaume pour une licorne
The Art of Dragon Age Inquistion: le retour du dragon
Les chemins de la mémoire - Scénario 1: Crise d'Amnésie
Les chemins de la mémoire - Scénario 2: Le secret des contrebandiers
Complainte des Landes Perdues T. 8: l'album du deuil
A cœur de l'inconnu: le manuel des explorateurs
Cœur de Pierre, âme de bronze
D3: un jeu de rôle a la David Simon
De la triche sur les dés
Decks de Spécialité: Explorateurs et mercenaires
Dessine-moi un monstre n 4: Le chatroll
Dishonored, the dunwall archives: Il n'est pas frais mon univers?!
Ecran du meneur de jeu: Médocs et mission secrète
Écran et Livret tactique: Opérations Friday Night
Fille de l'hiver: sortir du nucléaire
Goof Old Ingland: Pu... deux ans !
Hoard of the ... & The rise of Tiamat
Kemble's Cascade: un qui est un Ovni avec des Ovni
L'œuf de dragon: il n'y a plus qu'à jouer!
La Quête: une campagne clés en main
La Rose Noire: au nom de la rose
Le code du chasseur de primes: Boba Fett au rapport !
Le kit pour MJ: Deux morceaux !
Le serment de la tour: mini-aventure !!!
Les Fantômes d'Eden: une petite ville si paisible
Les trésors du dernier millénaire: fouet, chapeau et pistolet laser
Nouvelle: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas
Star Wars - Dark Times: La déchéance des Jedis
The Lands of Ice and Fire: cartographie du Trône de fer
Warlords of Draenor: il faut battre la Horde de fer tant qu'elle est chaude
Within: L'horreur dans tous ses états
184277.description:
(Translated) from the cover


Retro UFO: Hystoire de Fou
DMG D&D5, Dieux ennemis, Pendragon
Interviews: D&D 5 and Fredéric Henry
Campaign "The paths of memory", French-styl medieval fantasy
New York Gigant 2: universe + scenario for Chroniques Oubliées contemporary
Scenarios: Pathfinder, Légendes de la Gardes, Chroniques Oubliées, Antika and Tunnels & Trolls.

184278.name: Buffy D6
184278.description:
Buffy the Vampire Slayer
D6 Role-Playing in the World of Buffy the Vampire Slayer

From the introduction:

Welcome to the wholly unofficial Buffy the Vampire Slayer role-playing game. Based on the Buffy television series and West End Game's D6 Classic system, the game seeks to bring some of the rollicking fun of the show to the gaming table.

User summary:

The rules as presented are lightly modified from the West End Games D6 system, primarily by removing science-fiction focused elements. The core rules present individual, well-developed sections for character building, skills and attributes, magic, actions and combat, and equipment. A concise bestiary is provided, as are hero templates and a list of resources.

184279.name: Adonis
184279.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crime actually does pay. It pays very well. And some people just can't help but look sexy raking in that money. Say hello to the best-looking, most likable bruiser ever to crush, murder, and steal his way to the top, the one and only Adonis, crime lord and bon vivant. He's making a killing and loving every second of it (because - really - what good is being handsome, rich, and powerful if you don't enjoy it?).

Adonis is a PL 11 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

184280.name: Patanoir
184280.description:
"The Baron's daughter is missing, and you are the man to find her. No problem. With your inexhaustible arsenal of hard-boiled similes, there is nothing you can't handle."

PataNoir is a homage to the classic stories of hard-boiled private investigators with a knack for describing everything with complex similes and metaphors. In PataNoir, you solve problems by manipulating the hard-boiled metaphors used by the main character to make sense of the world in which he lives.

Source: The Game Website.

184281.description:
Coloretto: +3-Karte is a promotional expansion for Coloretto consisting of 2 cards, given away for free at Stadt-Land-Spielt 2015.

The card adds 3 points to the final standings.
184281.name: Coloretto: +3-Karte

184283.name: NioH
videogamehonor: 2016 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
184283.description:
The game follows the story of a blond-haired Samurai, the son of a Japanese lord and a Western woman in 16th-century Japan, during the Warring States period.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ni-Oh", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

184284.name: A Party of Wizards
184284.description:
The wizard school charges a lot of money and doesn't really do a lot for the wannabe wizard. It teaches them how to formulate spells and to access the power within them, but that's it. A week of tuition then out on your ear with nothing but a quill, ink, and an empty spell book.

A Party of Wizards is an RPG of heroic (if apprentice) wizards, kicked out into the real world to battle monsters and villains and make up their own spells to do it with.

The game is only 8 pages long and provided in standard PDF form. It is also provided in "PocketMod" PDF. You can print the Pocketmod PDF version on a single sheet of paper and fold it into a pocket size booklet known as a PocketMod.

- Publisher Blurb

184285.name: Gravity Rush 2
videogamehonor: 2016 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
184285.description:
User Summary

The sequel to Gravity Rush.

184286.name: SaGa: Scarlet Grace
184286.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

The newest edition to the Saga franchise.

184287.description:
You start with seven cards and try to get rid of your cards as fast as possible. If a player has discarded all his cards, the remaining players count the points in their hand. When a player reaches the agreed maximum score, the player with the lowest score wins.

If you can't, or don't want to play a card, you draw one from the deck. There are four colours with numbers from 1 to 9. You can either play colour on colour or number on number. Sounds boring so far, doesn't it?

Well, that's why we have the special cards. For example, have someone draw four cards from the deck, or give a fellow player two cards out of your hand. And the fun part: You always get to choose, whom you give these cards to!

But wait, there's more:

So, we come to the black cards, also with numbers from 1 to 9. You can only play these on a number, not on the same colour. Every time, a black card is being played, it activates an event card.
These event cards go from Friday, the Thirteenth - where nothing happens – to Tornado – where all hand cards get shuffled together and handed out again.
184287.name: Frantic

184288.name: Lovecraftesque Bare-bones Edition
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
184288.description:
Designer's Description:

This is a free-to-download, bare-bones edition of Lovecraftesque, released ahead of the kickstarter.

Lovecraftesque is a GMless storytelling game of brooding cosmic horror. You and your friends will each contribute strange clues to a slow-building mystery, culminating in a journey into darkness that ends in a climactic scene of horror. You will be surprised and creeped out by your friends' contributions, but the game is designed so that it will feel like one person was GMing it, even though you never had to break the tension by pausing for discussion.

The game focuses on a single Witness, who is at the mercy of strange and terrifying events. Lovecraft's stories rarely featured parties of investigators, and the hero rarely wins - that's how our game works, too. You rotate responsibility for playing the Witness, but the role is much more about revealing their inner thoughts and fears than solving the mystery or beating up cultists.

When you play Lovecraftesque you'll be creating your own mystery, and your own unique monsters that will feel like something out of Lovecraft's notebook. There won't be any Mi-Go or Deep Ones - you'll get a completely fresh take on the genre.﻿

184289.name: BBSW: Big Breasts, Small Waist - The Hentai Roleplaying Game
184289.description:
BBSW: Big Breasts, Small Waist is a web published roleplaying game focused on sexual situations and activities. The system is point based and similar to both GURPS and BESM: Big Eyes, Small Mouth, but uses only d10s for task resolution. Each character has three attributes, Body, Looks, and Talk. Abilities may be purchased to flesh out the character (also similar to GURPS and BESM) by taking disadvantages to gain points to spend. Social interaction, combat and intercourse yield "Sexperience" points which can be spent to increase attributes or skills. There are also rules for various sorts of erotic equipment.

Three settings were originally presented. Hentai Earth, Fairy Land, and Hell.

The game has been circulated in (at least) two versions -- 0.5 (2011), credited to Zaratustra, and 1.0 (2001), credited to B.B. The 1.0 version has expanded lists and a concise introduction to basic roleplaying concepts, but is essentially unchanged. How the 1.0 version was released ten years before the 0.5 version is unexplained. There is also another version credited to Zaratustra released in 2001, further confusing issues.

184290.name: With All Due Respect: The Party Game
184290.description:
With All Due Respect is a new light-hearted game about what you and your friends really think of each other!

With All Due Respect - The Party Game is an adult party game for 2+ people. Gameplay is incredibly simple and unique.

Before the game starts decide who is lucky enough to be on your VIP LIST. When a player is answering a "With All Due Respect" playing card they choose their answer from this list.

You can add other people who are not playing the game to the VIP LIST. Adding these other people will give you more names to choose from when answering questions.

On your turn:
1.) Draw a playing card, choose any question from the card and read it out loud starting "With All Due Respect".
2.) You then secretly write down on your answer pad a name from the VIP LIST that you think is the best answer.
3.) Now everyone else will use their 2 Poker Chips to guess which answer you selected.

As fun and ridiculous as it may seem, it gets even more hilarious. The questions alone will sprout hours of laughter and debate. But unlike any other party game their are Drawing Cards and Wild Cards to play.

You will have the opportunity to draw a person from the VIP LIST and everyone else will use their 2 Poker Chips to guess your drawing.

Playing With All Due Respect - The Party Game is like taking your basic adult party game and injecting some steroids into it!

The player with the most points after 12 rounds wins the game.

184291.name: Bushi d6
184291.description:
User summary:

The Bushi d6 core rules assume the reader is familiar with basic roleplaying concepts and methods. Characters have four attributes (Might, Agility, Wit, and Charm), hit points, and skills. Basic skill performance is based on the related attribute (e.g., Axe/Mace skill is based upon Might). Characters may chose to specialize in non-combat skills, one of which allows spellcasting.

Non-combat contested actions are resolved by adding attribute plus skill plus die roll and comparing that to a target difficulty. Combat uses a similar process with more complexity in modifiers and a variable target difficulty based on the opponent. Combat need not be damaging--several options are presented (for example, tripping).

The rules also include a section presenting magic spells and a basic "bestiary" of monsters. The final section of the document focuses on the setting of the game--The Empire of Honzu (a campaign map is provided as a separate document).

184292.name: Patron
184292.description:
“Welcome to Rome” the eunich said as you enter the official's ante chamber, “We have been expecting you and have prepared the Senate for your arrival.” Lucius Quintellius will be here within the hour with your requested documents...

Patron is a card game where each player takes the role of a freedman, a class without oblique power, but very energetic and ambitious. You will seek to control the correct mix of Senators from various classes, affluent locations with vast prestige and resources and the laws of Rome itself.

Setup

Shuffle all the cards of Patron deck together and choose a starting player. Draw cards appropriate to the number of players, and choose one to play and discard the rest. In a 2 player game, draw three cards. In a 3 player game draw two cards. In a 4 or 5 player game draw two, but players also have the option of playing the top card of the discard pile instead of drawing.

Playing the Game

When playing a card, you must do that action stated on the card, but only if can: i.e. if a card requires you to sacrifice a Patrician and you don't have one, you may ignore the effect. In a 4 or 5 player game, do not mix sacrificed cards with the discard pile. A sacrificed personality is removed from the game.

Each player draws and plays in a clockwise fashion until there are no cards left to draw and the game is over. If there is only one card left the last player must play this card as their final card. Then each player tabulates their total.

Determining a Winner

The player with the most points at the very end of the game wins. Many cards are worth variable points based on the number of symbols, locations, agendas or personalities that player has.

184293.name: Jenga: Transformers – Rise of the Fallen
184293.description:
From Publisher:

Are you ready for a new twist on Jenga? Bring home the classic game of falling bricks coupled with elements from the blockbuster Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen movie. For ages 6 and up, this family game for two or more players allows you to take control of Cybertron-- or family game night-- with your robot-like brick-removal skill. The tiles feature Autobot or Decepticon faction logos and are made from a tasteful, black material. Build and battle with the Transformers Revenge of the Fallen Jenga Battle Game!

How to Play:

Divide up into two teams Autobots and Decepticons. The Decepticons go first. Teams alternate turns, rotating so that each player gets chance to play.

on you turn, remove one block. Then see if the block shows a symbol:

if it does not show your TEAM´s symbol, stack the block on top of the tower
if it shows your TEAM´s symbol, pass it to a player of your choice on the other team. this player must stack the block before the team takes its turn.




Winning:

If the tower falls over on your team´s turn, your TEAM LOSES. The other TEAM WIN!.

184296.name: Click and Lock Modules
184296.description:
Provided as two files, the first (1 page) includes blank click and lock modules for creating adventures from scratch; the second (12 pages) includes filled click and lock modules extracted from the main game book, a basic layout sheet for joining click and lock modules, a layout sheet with additional data points, and a large-format layout sheet for heroes and villains.

These are particularly useful for playing the game without cutting up or photocopying the core book. The blank click and lock module sheet is provided either as a single-page PDF or as an Adobe Illustrator file.

184297.name: Runbow
videogamehonor: 2015 CVA Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2015 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
184297.description:
DESCRIPTION
Get ready for local multiplayer like you've never seen!

Runbow is a fast-paced action party game with a never-before seen color mechanic: Up-to nine players race against each other as platforms and obstacles appear and disappear when the background changes colors. Players can sprint against each other in Run, or go head-to-head in one of Runbow’s six additional modes, including Arena, King of the Hill, ColourMaster and The Bowhemoth.

FEATURES
· Local Nine-player Multiplayer – The biggest couch-multiplayer experience to come to Wii U, ever!

· If You Can’t See It, It Doesn’t Exist! – Players must think fast as obstacles appear and disappear with the changing backgrounds.

· Play Online! – Play Run, Arena, and King of the Hill in Open or Private parties with people all over the world!

· Hundreds of Challenges – Runbow’s packed to the brim with challenging levels and endless permutations of color transitions and obstacles!

· Six Great Game Modes – Challenge friends in King of the Hill, Arena, Run, and ecome the ColourMaster and dominate Runbow’s colorful world. Or play by yourself or with friends in Adventure or Bowhemoth, our toughest platforming challenge yet.

· One Master to Rule Them All – Play against friends in ColourMaster mode, where challengers race against one malevolent ColourMaster who controls the colours and obstacles in the level.

· Master The Bowhemoth – Runbow’s toughest game mode, The Bowhemoth, has racers tackle more than 30 minutes of platforming challenges that will put the patience and skill of even the toughest players to the test.

· Tons of Unlockable Costumes – From Pirate to Zombie to Ninja, players can pick the runner that's right for them.

· Challenges, Achievements, and More – Hours of replayability and unlockable content will keep gamers running back for more.

· Indie Guest Characters! – Shovel Knight, CommanderVideo, Gunvolt and more have joined the race! Unlock them all!

Source: The Publisher Website.

184298.name: WarChess-X: The Armageddon
184298.description:
It's 2020 A.D.: World War 3
You are Commander-in-chief of a super power about to clash with another.

1 Globe
2 Hemispheres
2 Commanders-in-chief
2 Super powers (Spread across both hemispheres)
4 Navies (2 each)
4 Armies (2 each)
4 Air forces (2 each)
Special Forces Marines
The Secret service (including double agents)
Strategic ICBM’s, Nuclear deterrents
Missile defence systems, Satellites & Radar
Bunkers, Cities, Logistical & Economic infrastructure




including the World Bank funding it all
And it’s epic war on all fronts.
it's Armageddon!

WarChess-X is a truly epic game in scope and in depth. A true union between strategic and tactical gaming.
An expansion on the WarChess army and navy themes including other forces and a commander-in-chief, you control a super-power spanning two hemispheres.

In this epic struggle for supremacy, your primary mission is to protect the commander-in-chief piece from being captured at all costs to avoid losing the war and to win the war, you must capture the opposing commander-in-chief.
Your secondary mission is to protect your flag bearers and strategic facilities namely your admirals or capital ships, generals, air-marshals, satellites and radar from capture or destruction as they control your unit forces, whilst trying to capture and destroy the opposing commanders and facilities to significantly weaken their forces.
Everything else is canon-fodder, dedicated to upholding and achieving your primary and secondary missions.

The army and navy pieces all move correspondent to their representative standard chess character. Most of the other pieces also all move similar to standard chess characters but some of them incorporate modifications to their movements, capturing and abilities. Then their are the static pieces that do not move as the represent infrastructure, so they have to be defended.
Finally, the whole epic plays out within an economics frame, where you have to acquire control and protect resources like oil, steel and gold to boost your war efforts and also to protect your cities to keep up morale.
It's not easy being the President, Good Luck.

184299.name: Atlas Hârnica Map E6
184299.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map E6 covers the eastern edge of the Kingdom of Rethem and the western edge of the Thardic Republic. The region includes the settlements of Menekai and Themeson, which are held by rival fighting orders dedicated to Agrik, dark god of fire and war. Other major settlements are Senun, an important trading town with the only bridge over the Gomisen River, and Imrium, the center of the most important salt-producing region on Hârn. The Rayesha Mountains, site of numerous mines and home to many dangerous creatures, dominate the eastern part of the region, while the thick forests to the west are home to the fierce Kubora tribesmen.

184300.name: Patrel
184300.description:
Publisher blurb:

Patrel is the site of the annual gathering of the nomadic Hodiri tribal nation. Located on the woodland plain of Horadir close to the Jebru River, Patrel features the largest natural spring in the area and provides excellent grazing for the tribesmen's horses.

The Patrel article describes the location's history and current situation. It provides details for the annual tribal gathering and many notable features of the site. Includes color GM and player maps of the settlement.

184301.name: King Cat: Feline Feuds
184301.description:
Cat and Medieval and Contemporary Household Themed. The cats are divided into royalty designations/strength ranking and are attempting to exert control over locations in a Kingdom i.e. a bedroom for the purposes of napping.

The gameplay consists of a drawing card then taking 1 or 2 actions of the following: placing cats in territories, placing Battle Cards of various types from the player's 4 card hand to give cats battle strength and scoring potential, battling opponent cats for control, and restoring cats after a battle. Drawing territories out of the deck and certain event cards add variety to gameplay/strategy.

The goal of the game is to have the most victory points at the end of the 3rd draw deck. the victory points are gained by dominating territory based on the cat's size, faction, and royal stack relative to opponents. A second way to earn victory points is to have a valid quirk or bonus VP stack by the game's end. There are penalties to VP for holding certain cards and for cats being defeated in battle.

184302.name: Menekai
184302.description:
Publisher blurb:

Menekai is the grim home of the brutal Order of the Red Shadows of Herpa, a fighting order dedicated to the god Agrik, the Emperor of Flame. Under Larga Gydsilen, their coarse and brutish grandmaster, the Red Shadows have made Menekai one of the richest fiefs in the Kingdom of Rethem by exploiting the region's mineral wealth.

The Menekai Castle article describes the settlement's history, government, religion, economics, and military forces. Includes a full description and color floor plans for the castle, along with color GM and player maps of the settlement. Details are given for many local craftsmen and other locations in the village.

184304.name: Capes Lite
184304.description:
From the introduction:

Capes is a radical departure from many roleplaying games. For many groups, it provides the tools to create better stories and
enjoy the process more. But it's genuinely not right for every group. This document should help you get some idea of what it's
about, and run your group through a quick session of the game.
This document assumes that you're familiar with more traditional forms of roleplaying already. If you've somehow happened upon
this document without ever having played another game then what follows may sound a bit nonsensical.

User summary:
Capes Lite presents the fundamentals of the Capes game, and makes it available as a free download. In Capes, there is no GM and D6 dice are used fairly sparingly to determine success of opposed actions. Character building is very rapid using pre-generated "click together" modules; the Lite version of the game does not have rules for creating your own modules.

184305.name: Capes Character Generator
184305.description:
The Capes Character Generator replaces the retired "Flash Clicks", and is an online-only character generator implemented in Flash. It supports all of the modules in the rules and also allows you to create unique modules.

The Titles tab has instructions; the Full Page tab shows a full page of Click and Lock Modules with selectable items; the Minor Parts tab show assembled modules where you can enter your own values, etc.; and the Supers tab has the completed hero/villain sheet. Once completed, the form can be printed. Currently there is no save mechanism.

184306.description: In Re-Extinction, dinosaurs have been resurrected for battle. Armor your dinosaurs to defend them from environmental hazards like stale grandma smell and boiling rivers of taco meat. Make every other player's dino re-extinct and be the last surviving dinosaur!
184306.name: Re-Extinction

184307.name: The Three Pillars: Extreme Hauntings Expansion Set
boardgameexpansion: The Three Pillars: A Paranormal Card Game
184307.description:
READY FOR MORE?

The stakes are about to be raised - the cases have gotten more dangerous as have the things that await you at each one. All-new card types challenge your team to the extreme! Entities appear when least expected to try and do more than just scare off your Pillars. Access the new Extreme Deck to search for Objects to help in the battle but there is a grave risk in doing so...the potential to be cursed! Perhaps your only hope lies in the new Clergy Pillar.

THE THREE PILLARS™: EXTREME HAUNTINGS expansion requires the Premiere Set to play. With 68 all new cards, you can add to your existing decks or freshen them up completely!

184308.name: Hellweg westfalicus: Dortmund
184308.description:
Postcard mini-expansion (available for download from the designer's website in German or English).

Dortmund is a new merchandise card.

Every time the owner of the card sells in Dortmund an item of merchandise of the types displayed, he received one extra Thaler (in combination with similar cards accumulating).

boardgamehonor: 2015 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended
184311.description:
From the publisher:
Bzzzz, bothersome flies are buzzing all around. Inviting landing pads are everywhere, but the flies only have eyes for the brown feasting pile of "fly candy". Only the player who plays his cards correctly can quickly move ahead with his flies! But beware! No one is safe from the fly swatter, and some flies may have to return to the starting point just before they reach their final destination.

User summary:
In Fly Feast, each player tries to move his four flies from the starting space to the destination. The players take turns. Each turn, they first draw a card. This triggers some effect, which may apply a permanent special effect to a space. After drawing the card, the may move one of their flies one or two spaces. The first player to reach the destination with all of his flies wins the game.
184311.name: Fliegenschmaus

184313.name: Total War: Warhammer
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best PC Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Winner
2016 Global Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
184313.description:
Total War: Warhammer is a turn-based strategy real-time tactics video game developed by the Creative Assembly and published by Sega. The game features the gameplay of the Total War series with factions of Games Workshop's Warhammer series. It is the 10th title in the Total War series and is the first title to be released in the Total War: Warhammer trilogy.

Gameplay

Total War: Warhammer is a turn-based strategy game with real-time tactical battles between armies. Unlike its predecessors, which feature historical settings, Warhammer introduces a fantasy setting as well as characters from the Warhammer universe. These characters, which include monsters, warriors, and heroes, can be controlled by the player. The game also features four playable factions at launch, which are the Empire, the Greenskins, the Dwarfs and the Vampire Counts. The Chaos faction is also available free to those who pre-order or purchase in the first week of release and subsequently available as downloadable content (DLC).

Each faction has access to their own unique units. For instance, the Greenskins faction features units such as Trolls, Giants and Arachnarok spiders. The Empire is a human faction, which features units like Steam Tanks. Each faction has their own unique campaign element. For example, a "Waaagh" system, which pushes the player to be constantly on the warpath, is unique to the Greenskins faction. A new quest mode featuring battles such as the "The Battle of Blackfire Pass" tasks players to complete missions and battles to receive unlockable items and abilities, is one of the new game modes offered in Warhammer. Flying creatures, such as dragons, also make appearances in the game. The campaign map is somewhat similar to the one in Attila with the exception being the diversity in physical terrain and climate as one moves from a particular point in the map to another. The campaign map spans from the Chaos wastes in the north to the Greenskin-infested badlands in the south and from the Great Ocean in the west to the Dwarven realms in the World's Edge mountains to the east. Magic is also one of the elements introduced in Warhammer with most of the factions such as the Empire and Vampire Counts having access to the various lores of magic and certain factions such as the Dwarfs and some non-Playable AI controlled factions having absolutely none or limited access to magic.

Unlike other Total War games, agents are featured in battles as well as the campaign map. Named agents can get injured in battles, while the unnamed ones could be killed and cannot be revived and used again. Total War: Warhammer features a wider variety of animations. For example, 30 types of different skeletons and body types are introduced in the game, instead of only five to six types as in its predecessors, as well as flying units. Other gameplay features from the Total War series, such as city-building, diplomacy and unit-building, remain unchanged in Warhammer.

Corruption is also featured in the game, although somewhat altered as it will be more of an external element caused by the presence of Vampire Count and Chaos armies rather than internal factors

Source: Wikipedia, "Total War: Warhammer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

184314.name: Bug Hunt
184314.description:
From publisher blurb:

By Order of the Oberfuhrer!

All weltkriegsmarine are called to the planet formerly known as Churchill IV to exterminate invasive fauna introduced to the planet to quell dissidents. Can you survive long enough to collect the reward?

Bug Hunt is an AWARD WINNING White Star compatible, OSR sci-fi one-sheet. This item is Pay What You Want -- Look for an expanded adventure set in the same universe, where the characters must contend with the mutant caliban, raging kriegstier, as well as Hauptmann Abendroth and his dreaded Raketekommandos!

184315.name: Last Transmission (2015)
184315.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE ROBOT HORDE OF THE NIPPON EMPIRE ATTACKS!

On the icy world of Khalkin Gol, the beleaguered forces of the Galactic Republic of China (GRC) must fend off the Laser Bots of the Dai Nippon Teikoku. But what is the GRC hiding on this fringe world? And why is the United Kingdom of Planets sending its crack Space Operations Executive teams into the chaos?

Last Transmission is a White Star compatible, OSR sci-fi one-sheet. This item is super cheap -- Look for an expanded adventure set in the same universe, where the characters must find the secrets hidden on Khalkin Gol before the Soviet Star Republic and the Nippon Empire clash in total planetary war!

184316.name: Galactic Ship Ops
184316.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is designed for players and GMs alike to create their very own ships as quickly as a couple minutes. It's fully compatible with the White Star Roleplaying Game, and ports easily over to any other OSR system, if it's not already 100% compatible.

It goes beyond the basics of starships presented in the White Star core rulebook to allow deeper customization with a standardized point-buy system. There's no bookkeeping beyond spending your points and choosing what you want the final stats (HP, Armor Class, etc.) to be. No poring over endless tables to find which hull rating your ship has and thus which reactor and other equipment it needs to install!

There's an expanded space combat system that gives every crew member something interesting to do during a fight, not just the Pilot. Five new classes, the Commander, Engineer, Flight Officer, Medical Officer and Science Officer expand the rich class selection of White Star with more space-themed character options.

An interstellar travel section allows you to send your players to the stars with new rules for using FTL drives.

A new selection of four ships, three designed for players and one to use as an antagonist, rounds out the book. Fly the Lightning Bug-class courier on smuggling missions, shuttle all sorts of interesting passengers through the galaxy with the Queen of New Brisbane-class yacht and engage your enemies in combat with the devastating Swallow-class fighter. Pit the players against the fearsome Supremacy-class super dreadnaught for the fight of their lives.

Adventure is at every star, and with Galactic Ship Ops you can take your game there immediately.

184317.name: The Graveyard at Lus
184317.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space Graveyards - what's left behind when battles are fought among the points of light that map out the universe. Sometimes there's good salvage to be had there. There's always danger, though. Not everything is dead in a Graveyard, and you're not the only one that's come looking for the good stuff. And that's not even mentioning the radiation and debris left behind, or the dangerous creatures that end up finding their way there like graveworms and ... the undead.

A comprehensive toolkit for creating space Graveyards - the result of battles between forces at war in the stars
Multiple tables for the creation of starship damage, system damage, and crew survivorship
An event table to ensure that exploration is dynamic during sandbox play
New rules for Cinematic and Realitic space combat
New starship technology including sensors and rules for targeting/repairing specific systems
Additional rules for space-based phenomena, space-based explosions, and boarding other starships
Four new alien races for your White Star RPG campaigns
Updated starship usage for four of the core alien races in the main game
Five new creatures, including The Unquiet, a horriffic form of undead
Use the pregenerated Graveyard At Lus for your own games, or as a guide to create your own Graveyards.
Worksheets and sample hexmaps at the rear of the book to help with generation of Graveyards
Designed for use with the White Star RPG, but easy to convert for other OSR sci-fi systems.




The Graveyard at Lus will be continually supported by the release of FREE expansion material that includes additional rules and other content, including new races, creatures, and tables to help support additional sandbox usage of the product beyond the core book here. This material will not be included in the core book, but as separate products. The first of these will be the release of all of the silhouettes of the starships in the book (and many more) for use in creation of your own counters for table-based play or use with a VTT.

184318.name: Hawkridge Hideout
184318.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you find Hawkridge Hideout, it's because someone wants you to find it. The Hawkridge Hills have always been a lonely place, which is why they were chosen to be the site of a tomb, centuries before. And when a group of bandits came to the area, it seemed the perfect location for their hideout. Nestled in a small cave at the back of the ancient tomb, the site is easily defended, and is now full of the spoils of the robbers industry. And if someone comes looking for trouble and doesn't back down, there's always a secret escape route.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting a hideout in a cave, behind an abandoned tomb. Ruins stand amid the trees outside, and the tomb is reached via a small set of stairs. The occupants of the hideout have built a simple barricade of boxes and barrels, and inside the cave, accessed from behind a tomb, the bandits have space to store their goods and sleep.

184319.name: Siphon
184319.description:
From publisher blurb:

SIPHON!

Born with an insidious gift to steal powers from other heroes and villains, Siphon is one adversary that's sure to make your group think twice. Having powers that she's permanently drained from another hero, she's ready to make your heroes regret ever putting on their costumes!
